translated: The ultimate reality is the

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag 'di dag phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang / ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du gal te /
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag 'di dag phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang / ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa de bzhin du gal te /
translated: The faculties, powers, and branches of enlightenment have distinct characteristics from each other, just as the eightfold noble path has distinct characteristics from each other.

original: chos de dag gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa'ang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par gyur na ni /🔽des na de bzhin nyid don dam pa /
analyzed: chos de dag gi de bzhin nyid don dam pa chos bdag med pa'ang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin par gyur na ni / des na de bzhin nyid don dam pa /
translated: If the faculties, powers, and limbs of awakening were to have distinct characteristics from each other, and if the suchness, ultimate, and absence of self in phenomena of those phenomena were to have distinct characteristics from each other, just as the noble eightfold path has distinct characteristics from each other,🔽then,

original: chos bdag med pa'ang rgyu dang bcas pa yin zhing rgyu las byung ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'ang rgyu dang bcas pa yin zhing rgyu las byung ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, the suchness, ultimate, and absence of self in phenomena would have a cause and would arise from a cause.

original: rgyu @18a *// las byung ba nyid yin na ni 'dus byas yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu @18a *// las byung ba nyid yin na ni 'dus byas yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they arose from a cause, they would be conditioned.

original: 'dus byas nyid yin na ni don dam pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid yin na ni don dam pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were conditioned, they would not be the ultimate.

original: don dam pa ma yin na ni don dam pa gzhan zhig yongs su btsal dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam pa ma yin na ni don dam pa gzhan zhig yongs su btsal dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not the ultimate, then another ultimate would have to be sought.

original: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid don dam pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid don dam pa /
translated: Subhūti, because the suchness, ultimate, and absence of self in phenomena

original: chos bdag med pa rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas ma yin pa dang / don dam pa ma yin pa ma yin pa dang / don dam pa de'i don dam pa gzhan yongs su btsal bar bya mi dgos kyi /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa rgyu las byung ba ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas ma yin pa dang / don dam pa ma yin pa ma yin pa dang / don dam pa de'i don dam pa gzhan yongs su btsal bar bya mi dgos kyi /
translated: It is not that the selflessness of phenomena is not arisen from causes, or is not conditioned, or is not ultimate, or that its ultimate must be sought elsewhere.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether the Tathāgatas arise or do not arise,🔽for the sake of establishing the Dharma, the realm of phenomena, forever and always,

original: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su chos gnas par bya ba'i phyir chos rnams kyi chos nyid dbyings de ni rnam par gnas pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su chos gnas par bya ba'i phyir chos rnams kyi chos nyid dbyings de ni rnam par gnas pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: the ultimate, which is the suchness of phenomena, is just as it is.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni don dam pa yin par rig par bya'o; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, by this one of many explanations you should know that the characteristic of the one taste of all is the ultimate.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this.

original: dper na / nam mkha' ni gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs du ma mtshan nyid tha dad pa la mtshan ma med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa 'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' ni gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs du ma mtshan nyid tha dad pa la mtshan ma med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: For example, space is the characteristic of the absence of signs, the absence of conceptualization, and the absence of change with regard to the various, numerous, different characteristics of forms.

original: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: It is the characteristic of being of one taste in all respects.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du don dam pa'ang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams la thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan @18b nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du don dam pa'ang mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams la thams cad du ro gcig pa'i mtshan @18b nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, the ultimate should be seen as the characteristic of being of one taste in all respects with regard to phenomena that have different characteristics.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then, the Bhagavān uttered the following verses:

original: don dam de ni tha dad ma yin te //
analyzed: don dam de ni tha dad ma yin te //
translated: “The ultimate is not different;

original: kun tu ro gcig mtshan nyid sangs rgyas gsung //
analyzed: kun tu ro gcig mtshan nyid sangs rgyas gsung //
translated: The Buddha has taught that it is of one taste in all respects.

original: de la gang dag tha dad kun rtog pa //
analyzed: de la gang dag tha dad kun rtog pa //
translated: Those who conceive of it as different

original: de dag nga rgyal gnas pa rmongs pa yin //
analyzed: de dag nga rgyal gnas pa rmongs pa yin //
translated: Are ignorant and remain in pride.

original: rab 'byor gyi le'u ste bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi le'u ste bzhi pa'o ////
translated: This was the fourth chapter on Subhūti.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' blo gros yangs pas zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' blo gros yangs pas zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vastu asked the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa /
translated: the bodhisattvas are skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa zhes bgyi na /
translated: Blessed One, if the bodhisattvas are skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang; rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang; rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa lags /
translated: to what extent are the bodhisattvas skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na'ang ji tsam gyis 'dogs lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na'ang ji tsam gyis 'dogs lags /
translated: To what extent does the Thus-Gone One designate the bodhisattvas as skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness?”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' blo gros yangs pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' blo gros yangs pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva Vast Intelligence, “Vast Intelligence, it is excellent, excellent that you have asked the Thus-Gone One about this matter.

original: blo gros yangs pa khyod de ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i don dang / phan pa dang @19a *//🔽bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa khyod de ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i don dang / phan pa dang @19a *// bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /
translated: “You, Viśālamati, have set out for the benefit of many beings, for the happiness of many beings, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
translated: You have asked the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: legs so // blo gros yangs pa /
analyzed: legs so // blo gros yangs pa /
translated: It is excellent, Viśālamati,🔽that you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: de'i phyir nyon cig dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon cig dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Viśālamati, listen well and keep in mind what I will now explain to you about the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: blo gros yangs pa /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa /
translated: Viśālamati,

original: 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di na sems can gang dang gang dag sems can gyi ris gang dang gang du'ang sgo nga nas skye ba'i skye gnas sam /🔽yang na mngal nas skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba 'di na sems can gang dang gang dag sems can gyi ris gang dang gang du'ang sgo nga nas skye ba'i skye gnas sam / yang na mngal nas skye ba'am /
translated: in this saṃsāra of the six classes of beings, whatever beings there are, in whatever class of beings they are, whether they are born from eggs,🔽or from the womb,

original: yang na drod gsher las skye ba'am /
analyzed: yang na drod gsher las skye ba'am /
translated: or from heat and moisture,

original: yang na rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas su lus mngon par 'grub cing 'byung bar 'gyur ba der dang por 'di ltar len pa rnam pa gnyis po rten dang bcas pa'i dbang po gzugs can len pa dang / mtshan ma dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa la tha snyad 'dogs pa'i spros pa'i bag chags len pa la rten nas /
analyzed: yang na rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas su lus mngon par 'grub cing 'byung bar 'gyur ba der dang por 'di ltar len pa rnam pa gnyis po rten dang bcas pa'i dbang po gzugs can len pa dang / mtshan ma dang ming dang rnam par rtog pa la tha snyad 'dogs pa'i spros pa'i bag chags len pa la rten nas /
translated: Or else, in the case of those who are born supernaturally, the body is formed and appears there, and first of all, on the basis of the two kinds of grasping, the grasping of the physical sense powers together with their support and the grasping of the habitual tendencies of the proliferation of conceptual thoughts and the designation of signs and names,🔽

original: sa bon thams cad pa'i sems rnam par smin cing 'jug la /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa'i sems rnam par smin cing 'jug la /
translated: Or else, in the case of those who are born supernaturally, the body is formed and appears there, and first of all the mind that contains all the seeds develops, matures, and engages in activity on the basis of the two kinds of grasping: the grasping of the physical sense faculties together with their supports and the grasping of the habitual tendencies of the conceptual elaborations of signs, names, and conceptualization.

original: rgyas shing 'phel ba dang yangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas shing 'phel ba dang yangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It grows, increases, and expands.

original: de la gzugs can gyi khams na ni len pa gnyi ga yod la /
analyzed: de la gzugs can gyi khams na ni len pa gnyi ga yod la /
translated: In the form realm, there is both kinds of grasping,

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i khams na ni len pa gnyis su med do; ;blo gros yangs pa /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i khams na ni len pa gnyis su med do; ;blo gros yangs pa /
translated: but in the formless realm, there is no grasping of the two kinds.

original: rnam par shes pa de ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Viśālamati, that consciousness is also called the appropriating consciousness,

original: 'di ltar des lus 'di bzung zhing blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar des lus 'di bzung zhing blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is that which takes up and appropriates this body.

original: kun gzhi rnam par @19b shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par @19b shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the all-ground consciousness.

original: 'di ltar de lus 'di la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis kun tu sbyor ba dang / rab tu sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de lus 'di la grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis kun tu sbyor ba dang / rab tu sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is connected to and engaged with this body in the sense of being its basis and its pleasure.

original: sems zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: sems zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called mind.

original: 'di ltar de ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kun tu bsags pa dang / nye bar bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kun tu bsags pa dang / nye bar bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the accumulation and collection of all forms, sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena.

original: blo gros yangs pa /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa /
translated: O you of vast intellect,

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la rten cing gnas nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la rten cing gnas nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: Ānanda, the six collections of consciousness arise in dependence on and based on that appropriating consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag 'byung ngo //🔽de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag 'byung ngo // de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas /
translated: They are the eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness.🔽“

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa /🔽dus mtshungs pa /🔽spyod yul mtshungs pa /🔽rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa / dus mtshungs pa / spyod yul mtshungs pa / rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang 'byung ngo //
translated: The mental consciousness that is associated with the eye consciousness,🔽that is simultaneous with it,🔽that has the same object as it, and that is conceptual also arises.🔽

original: blo gros yangs pa /🔽de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang / reg bya rnams la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /🔽lus kyi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa / de la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang / reg bya rnams la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste / lus kyi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: The mental consciousness that conceptualizes also arises.🔽“Bhaiṣajya-rāja, the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses also arise in the same way.

original: dus mtshungs pa /🔽spyod yul mtshungs pa /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa / spyod yul mtshungs pa /
translated: “Bhaiṣajya-rāja, the eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang 'byung ngo //🔽gal te mig gi @20a *//
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang 'byung ngo // gal te mig gi @20a *//
translated: The mental consciousness that conceptualizes also arises.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig lhan cig 'byung na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang spyod yul mtshungs pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig lhan cig 'byung na ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang spyod yul mtshungs pa /
translated: “Bhaiṣajya-rāja, if one eye consciousness arises, then the mental consciousness that conceptualizes arises in a similar way.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na lhan cig 'byung ngo //🔽gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gnyis sam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na lhan cig 'byung ngo // gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gnyis sam /
translated: Only one conceptual mental consciousness arises together with them.

original: gsum mam / bzhi lhan cig gam /
analyzed: gsum mam / bzhi lhan cig gam /
translated: If two or three or four or five of the groups of consciousness arise together,

original: lnga char lhan cig 'byung na'ang der rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang spyod yul mtshungs pa /
analyzed: lnga char lhan cig 'byung na'ang der rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang spyod yul mtshungs pa /
translated: then in that case, in addition to the five groups of consciousness,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang gcig kho na lhan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang gcig kho na lhan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: only one conceptual mental consciousness arises together with them.

original: blo gros yangs pa /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa /
translated: “Viśālamati,

original: 'di lta ste; dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; dper na /
translated: it is like this:

original: chu'i klung chen po 'bab pa la gal te rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: chu'i klung chen po 'bab pa la gal te rlabs gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: For example, in a great river flowing, if the conditions for the arising of a single wave are present,

original: rlabs kyang gcig kho na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rlabs kyang gcig kho na 'byung ngo //
translated: then a single wave arises.

original: gal te rlabs gnyis sam; gal te rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rlabs gnyis sam; gal te rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: If the conditions for the arising of two or three or many waves are present,🔽then two or three or many waves arise.

original: rlabs rab tu mang po dag 'byung zhing chu'i klung de rang gi rgyun gyis rgyun 'chad par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rlabs rab tu mang po dag 'byung zhing chu'i klung de rang gi rgyun gyis rgyun 'chad par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: And even though many waves arise in the river, the river is not exhausted.

original: yongs su zad par yang mi 'gyur ro //🔽me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la'ang gal te gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: yongs su zad par yang mi 'gyur ro // me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la'ang gal te gzugs brnyan gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: And even though the river is not exhausted, the waves do not cease.🔽“Subhūti, it is the same with the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha.

original: gzugs brnyan yang gcig kho na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan yang gcig kho na 'byung ngo //
translated: If the conditions for the arising of one reflection are present, then one reflection arises.

original: gal te gzugs brnyan gnyis sam /
analyzed: gal te gzugs brnyan gnyis sam /
translated: If the conditions for the arising of two reflections are present, then two reflections arise.

original: gal te rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na /🔽@20b gzugs brnyan rab tu mang po dag 'byung zhing me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan gyi dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te rab tu mang po dag 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na / @20b gzugs brnyan rab tu mang po dag 'byung zhing me long gi dkyil 'khor de gzugs brnyan gyi dngos por yongs su 'gyur ba'ang ma yin la /
translated: If the conditions for the arising of many reflections are present, then many reflections arise.🔽And yet the surface of the mirror does not become the thing that is the reflection.

original: yongs su sbyor bar yang mi mngon no //
analyzed: yongs su sbyor bar yang mi mngon no //
translated: And yet the surface of the mirror is not seen to be empty of the reflection.

original: blo gros yangs pa /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa /
translated: “Subhūti, it is the same with the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha.

original: de bzhin du chu klung lta bu dang / me long lta bu'i len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la rten cing gnas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu klung lta bu dang / me long lta bu'i len pa'i rnam par shes pa de la rten cing gnas nas /
translated: In the same way, the appropriating consciousness, which is like a river or a flowing stream, is the support and basis for the arising of the various consciousnesses.

original: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig lan gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na'ang mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na lan gcig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig lan gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na'ang mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na lan gcig 'byung ngo //
translated: If the conditions for the arising of a single visual consciousness are present, then only a single visual consciousness arises.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga char gyi bar dag lan gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na'ang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga char lan gcig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga char gyi bar dag lan gcig 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur na'ang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga char lan gcig 'byung ngo //
translated: If the conditions for the arising of all five collections of consciousness are present, then all five collections of consciousness arise.

original: blo gros yangs pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi lugs shes pa la brten cing chos kyi lugs shes pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi lugs shes pa la brten cing chos kyi lugs shes pa la gnas nas /
translated: “Viśālamati, in this way, the bodhisattvas, on the basis of understanding the system of the Dharma and in dependence on understanding the system of the Dharma,

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na de tsam gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'dogs so //
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na de tsam gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'dogs so //
translated: They are skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness, but the Thus-Gone One does not designate them as bodhisattvas skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness simply on that basis.

original: blo gros yangs pa /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa /
translated: “Vast Mind,

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' nang gi so so nang gi len pa mi mthong /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' nang gi so so nang gi len pa mi mthong /
translated: because bodhisattvas do not see internal appropriation,

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong la /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong la /
translated: nor do they see the consciousness that appropriates,

original: de'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin pa dang / kun gzhi yang @21a *//
analyzed: de'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin pa dang / kun gzhi yang @21a *//
translated: and because they see things as they are,

original: mi mthong / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: mi mthong / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /
translated: they do not see the foundation consciousness,🔽nor do they see the foundation consciousness,

original: bsags pa'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: bsags pa'ang mi mthong /
translated: nor do they see accumulation,

original: sems kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: sems kyang mi mthong /
translated: nor do they see the mind,

original: mig kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: mig kyang mi mthong /
translated: nor do they see the eyes,

original: gzugs kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: gzugs kyang mi mthong /
translated: nor do they see forms,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /🔽rna ba'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong / rna ba'ang mi mthong /
translated: nor do they see eye consciousness,🔽nor do they see the ears,

original: sgra'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: sgra'ang mi mthong /
translated: nor do they see sounds,

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the ear consciousness.

original: sna'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: sna'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the nose.

original: dri'ang mi mthong /🔽sna'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: dri'ang mi mthong / sna'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see smells.🔽They do not see the nose consciousness.

original: lce'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: lce'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the tongue.

original: ro'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: ro'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see tastes.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the tongue consciousness.

original: lus kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: lus kyang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the body.

original: reg bya'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: reg bya'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see textures.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the body consciousness.

original: blo gros yangs pa /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa /
translated: “Viśālamati,

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' nang gi so so rang gi yid kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' nang gi so so rang gi yid kyang mi mthong /
translated: because bodhisattvas do not see the inner, individual, personal mind,

original: chos rnams kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: chos rnams kyang mi mthong /
translated: they do not see phenomena,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong la /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'ang mi mthong la /
translated: and they do not see the mind consciousness.

original: de'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yin pa de ni /
translated: And because that is the case,

original: byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: they are called bodhisattvas who are skilled in the ultimate.🔽“

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa la mkhas pa ni sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin par 'dogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang byang chub sems dpa' don dam pa la mkhas pa ni sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin par 'dogs so //
translated: The Thus-Gone One also designates the bodhisattvas who are skilled in the ultimate as skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: blo gros yangs pa /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa /
translated: “Vast Mind,

original: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin la /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas pa yin la /
translated: that is how bodhisattvas become skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / @21b rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na'ang de tsam gyis 'dogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dang / yid dang / @21b rnam par shes pa'i gsang ba la mkhas par 'dogs na'ang de tsam gyis 'dogs so //
translated: The Thus-Gone One designates bodhisattvas as skilled in the secrets of mind, thought, and consciousness based on just that.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: “The appropriating consciousness is profound and subtle;

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab //
translated: All seeds flow in it like a river.

original: bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: Fearing that they would imagine it to be a self,

original: byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //
translated: I have not taught it to the childish.

original: blo gros yangs pa'i le'u ste lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa'i le'u ste lnga pa'o ////
translated: This was the fifth chapter, “Vast Intelligence,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas kyi zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas kyi zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Guṇākara asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽when it is said that a bodhisattva is skilled in the characteristics of phenomena,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa zhes bgyi na /
translated: what is meant by a bodhisattva being skilled in the characteristics of phenomena?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji tsam gyis na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na /
translated: to what extent

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa lags /
translated: is a bodhisattva skilled in the characteristics of phenomena?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'dogs na'ang ji tsam gyis 'dogs lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'dogs na'ang ji tsam gyis 'dogs lags /
translated: To what extent does the Thus-Gone designate a bodhisattva as skilled in the characteristics of phenomena?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' yon tan 'byung gnas la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva Guṇākara,🔽“Guṇākara,

original: yon tan 'byung gnas khyod de ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas khyod de ltar skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs te /
translated: You have entered the path for the benefit of many beings, for the happiness of many beings, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans.

original: de @22a *// bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
analyzed: de @22a *// bzhin gshegs pa la khyod don 'di nyid 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
translated: It is excellent that you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about the meaning of this.

original: legs so // yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: legs so // yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: Well said, Guṇākara!

original: de'i phyir nyon cig dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon cig dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, listen, and I will explain to you the expertise in the characteristics of phenomena.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: Guṇākara,

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
translated: there are three characteristics of phenomena.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The imagined characteristic, the dependent characteristic, and the thoroughly established characteristic.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: Guṇākara,

original: de la chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the imagined identity of phenomena?

original: ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu ming dang brdar rnam par bzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu ming dang brdar rnam par bzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the nature or particularity of phenomena that is established by names and symbols to the extent that they are designated by conventional expressions.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: “Guṇākara,

original: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: what is the relative identity of phenomena?

original: chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid de /
translated: It is the dependent origination of phenomena.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
translated: It is as follows:🔽because this exists, that comes to be;

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba 'di lta ste /
translated: because this has arisen, that arises.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That is to say, with ignorance as condition, there are volitions;

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa'o //
translated: and so on up to: in this way, there comes to be the arising of this entire great mass of suffering.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: “Guṇākara,

original: chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: what is the perfect identity of phenomena?

original: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the reality of phenomena.

original: byang @22b chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtun pa'i rgyu dang / legs par tshul bzhin yid la byas pa'i rgyus de rtogs shing /
analyzed: byang @22b chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtun pa'i rgyu dang / legs par tshul bzhin yid la byas pa'i rgyus de rtogs shing /
translated: It is realized by bodhisattvas through the cause of their diligence and the cause of their proper attention.

original: de rtogs pa goms par byas pa yang dag par grub pas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa goms par byas pa yang dag par grub pas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: And it is realized through the accomplishment of the practice of that realization, up to the accomplishment of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: “Guṇākara,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / skyes bu gang zag rab rib can gyi mig la rab rib kyi skyon chags pa de lta bur ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu gang zag rab rib can gyi mig la rab rib kyi skyon chags pa de lta bur ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The imagined characteristic should be seen as being like the eye disease of a person with eye disease.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: Guṇākara,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:🔽The signs of that eye disease are like the signs of eye disease, such as

original: dper na / de nyid la rab rib kyi mtshan ma skra shad 'dzings pa'am /
analyzed: dper na / de nyid la rab rib kyi mtshan ma skra shad 'dzings pa'am /
translated: knots of hair,🔽flies,

original: sbrang ma'am / til gyi 'bru 'am /🔽sngon po'i mtshan ma'am /🔽ser po'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: sbrang ma'am / til gyi 'bru 'am / sngon po'i mtshan ma'am / ser po'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: sesame seeds,🔽blue signs,🔽yellow signs,

original: dmar po'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: dmar po'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: red signs,

original: dkar po'i mtshan ma snang bar gyur pa de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i mtshan ma snang bar gyur pa de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The dependent characteristic should be seen in that way, as the appearance of the signs of the pure.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: “Guṇākara,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / skyes bu gang zag de nyid kyi mig yongs su dag cing mig la rab rib kyi skyon chags pa dang bral bar gyur pa na /
translated: when the eyes of that very person are completely pure and free from the fault of the eye disease of cataracts,

original: mig de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi spyod yul ma nor ba'i spyod yul de lta bur ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi spyod yul ma nor ba'i spyod yul de lta bur ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: the nature of those very eyes is the undeluded domain. The perfected characteristic should be seen in that way.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: “Guṇākara,

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / shel shin tu gsal pa ni gang gi tshe tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni nor du rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen @23a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / shel shin tu gsal pa ni gang gi tshe tshon sngon po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni nor du rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen @23a *//
translated: it is like this:

original: po lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: po lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: when a very clear crystal comes into contact with a blue dye, at that time it appears like a sapphire or a great lapis lazuli.

original: nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen por log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen por log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
translated: and the precious gem, the sapphire, and the great lapis lazuli, are also the cause of delusion for sentient beings.

original: gang gi tshe tshon dmar po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshon dmar po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When it comes into contact with red dye, it appears like a precious ruby.

original: nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga ru log par 'dzin pas sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga ru log par 'dzin pas sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
translated: And the precious gem, the ruby, is also the cause of delusion for sentient beings.

original: gang gi tshe na tshon ljang khu dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni nor bu rin po che margad lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na tshon ljang khu dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni nor bu rin po che margad lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When it comes into contact with green dye, it appears like a precious emerald.

original: nor bu rin po che mrgad du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che mrgad du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
translated: And the precious gem, the emerald, is also the cause of delusion for sentient beings.

original: gang gi tshe tshon ser po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni gser lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshon ser po dang phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni gser lta bur snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When it comes into contact with yellow dye, it appears like gold.

original: gser du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: gser du log par 'dzin pas kyang sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
translated: The misapprehension of gold also causes sentient beings to be confused.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: Guṇākara,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / shel shin tu gsal ba tshon dang phrad pa de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad kyi bag chags su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / shel shin tu gsal ba tshon dang phrad pa de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad kyi bag chags su blta bar bya'o //
translated: just as a very clear crystal comes into contact with color, so should the dependent characteristic be regarded as the habitual tendency of the conventional designation of the imagined characteristic.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na; shel shin tu gsal ba la nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / margad dang / gser du log par 'dzin pa lta bur ni gzhan @23b gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na; shel shin tu gsal ba la nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / margad dang / gser du log par 'dzin pa lta bur ni gzhan @23b gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: just as there is a misapprehension of a very clear crystal as a sapphire, a great lapis lazuli, a ruby, a emerald, or gold, so should the apprehension of the dependent characteristic as the imagined characteristic be regarded.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: Guṇākara,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / shel shin tu gsal ba de nyid lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / shel shin tu gsal ba de nyid lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o //
translated: just as that very clear crystal itself, so should the dependent characteristic be regarded.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / shel shin tu gsal ba nyid nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / mrgad dang / gser gyi mtshan nyid der rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su yongs su ma grub cing ngo bo nyid med pa de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: dper na / shel shin tu gsal ba nyid nor bu rin po che aan da rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / padma r'a ga dang / mrgad dang / gser gyi mtshan nyid der rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su yongs su ma grub cing ngo bo nyid med pa de lta bur ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: For example, the nature of a very clear crystal is not established as an emerald, a great sapphire, a ruby, a beryl, or gold, and is not established as having the characteristics of gold, and so on, forever and ever, always and always.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su yongs su ma grub cing ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o; ;yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid der rtag pa rtag pa'i dus dang / ther zug ther zug gi dus su yongs su ma grub cing ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid blta bar bya'o; ;yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: The imagined characteristic should be seen as the perfected characteristic by the non-establishment and lack of intrinsic nature of the imagined characteristic as an emerald, and so on, forever and ever, always and always.🔽“Guṇākara,

original: de la mtshan ma dang 'brel pa'i ming la brten nas ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma dang 'brel pa'i ming la brten nas ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: the imagined characteristic is known based on names that are connected with signs.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa la brten nas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa la brten nas ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: On the basis of the attachment to the imagined identity in the relative identity, one understands the relative identity.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa la brten nas ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa la brten nas ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes so //
translated: On the basis of the absence of attachment to the imagined identity in the relative identity, one understands the perfect identity.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi gzhan @24a *//
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas / de la byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi gzhan @24a *//
translated: Gunākara,

original: gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: in this regard, when bodhisattvas understand the imagined identity in the relative identity of phenomena just as it is, they understand the identitylessness of phenomena just as it is.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: Gunākara,

original: de la byang chub sems dpas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
translated: in this regard, when bodhisattvas understand the relative identity just as it is,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He fully understands the characteristics of the phenomena of complete affliction just as they are.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: “Guṇākara,

original: de la byang chub sems dpas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
translated: when the bodhisattva fully understands the characteristic of the perfected just as it is,

original: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: he fully understands the characteristics of the phenomena of complete purification just as they are.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: “Guṇākara,

original: de la byang chub sems dpas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na /
translated: when the bodhisattva fully understands the characteristic of the dependent just as it is,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong ngo //
translated: he abandons the characteristics of the phenomena of complete affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs na rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs na rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When he abandons the characteristics of the phenomena of complete affliction, he attains the characteristics of the phenomena of complete purification.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas /
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas /
translated: “Guṇākara,

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpas de ltar chos rnams kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yang @24b dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing mtshan nyid med pa dang /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la; mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpas de ltar chos rnams kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yang @24b dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing mtshan nyid med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la; mtshan nyid med pa'i chos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas /
translated: Because bodhisattvas know the characteristics of phenomena—the imputed characteristic, the dependent characteristic, and the thoroughly established characteristic—in a correct and thoroughgoing way, and they know the characteristic of the absence of characteristics,🔽the characteristic of the afflictive and the characteristic of the purified, in a correct and thoroughgoing way, and they know the characteristic of phenomena that is the absence of characteristics in a correct and thoroughgoing way,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs na rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'thob par 'gyur ba de tsam gyis na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spong zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu spangs na rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'thob par 'gyur ba de tsam gyis na /
translated: they abandon the phenomena that are characterized by the afflictive and, when they have abandoned the phenomena that are characterized by the afflictive, they attain the phenomena that are characterized by the purified.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa yin la /
translated: The bodhisattva is skilled in the characteristics of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'dogs na'ang de tsam gyis 'dogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas par 'dogs na'ang de tsam gyis 'dogs so //
translated: The Tathāgata designates the bodhisattva as skilled in the characteristics of phenomena.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Bhagavān uttered the following verses:

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos ni rab shes na //🔽kun nas nyon mongs mtshan nyid chos spong 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos ni rab shes na // kun nas nyon mongs mtshan nyid chos spong 'gyur //
translated: “Having understood the Dharma that is without characteristics,🔽One abandons the Dharma that has the characteristics of defilement.

original: kun nas nyon mongs chos ni rab spangs na //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs chos ni rab spangs na //
translated: Having abandoned the Dharma that is defiled,

original: shin tu rnam dag mtshan nyid chos thob 'gyur //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag mtshan nyid chos thob 'gyur //
translated: One attains the Dharma that has the characteristic of complete purity.

original: skye bo bag med nyes bcom le lo can //
analyzed: skye bo bag med nyes bcom le lo can //
translated: “People who are destroyed by the fault of carelessness and laziness

original: 'du byed skyon la rtog par mi byed pa //
analyzed: 'du byed skyon la rtog par mi byed pa //
translated: Do not contemplate the faults of conditioned things.

original: brtan med g-yo ba yod pa'i chos rnams la //
analyzed: brtan med g-yo ba yod pa'i chos rnams la //
translated: They are unstable and have changeable qualities.

original: rab tu nyams pas snying brtser bya ba yin //
analyzed: rab tu nyams pas snying brtser bya ba yin //
translated: They are to be pitied because of their complete degeneration.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas kyi le'u ste drug pa'o ////
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas kyi le'u ste drug pa'o ////
translated: This was the sixth chapter, on the “Source of Qualities,” of this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang @25a *//🔽dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' don dam yang @25a *// dag 'phags kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Paramārthasamudgata said to the Bhagavat:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavat,

original: 'di na bdag gcig pu dben pa zhig na mchis pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di na bdag gcig pu dben pa zhig na mchis pa'i tshe /
translated: when I was alone in seclusion,

original: sems kyi yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu skyes lags te /
analyzed: sems kyi yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu skyes lags te /
translated: this thought occurred to me:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar phung po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar phung po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: ‘The Bhagavat has spoken in many ways about the defining characteristics of the aggregates,

original: skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spang ba dang yongs su shes pa yang bka' stsal /
analyzed: skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spang ba dang yongs su shes pa yang bka' stsal /
translated: the defining characteristics of their arising, the defining characteristics of their cessation, and their abandonment and comprehension.

original: phung po rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / zas rnams kyi yang bka' stsal /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / zas rnams kyi yang bka' stsal /
translated: Just as with the aggregates, he has spoken about the sense spheres, dependent arising, and the sustenances.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar bden pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar bden pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: The Bhagavat has spoken in many ways about the defining characteristics of the truths,

original: yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba dang / mngon du bgyi ba dang / bsgom pa'ang bka' stsal /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang / spang ba dang / mngon du bgyi ba dang / bsgom pa'ang bka' stsal /
translated: He has also taught the complete understanding, abandonment, realization, and cultivation of the constituents.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar khams rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar khams rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: “The Blessed One has taught the individual characteristics of the constituents in many ways.

original: khams sna tshogs pa nyid dang / khams du ma nyid dang / spang ba dang / yongs su shes pa'ang bka' stsal /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs pa nyid dang / khams du ma nyid dang / spang ba dang / yongs su shes pa'ang bka' stsal /
translated: He has also taught the diversity of the constituents, the multiplicity of the constituents, their abandonment, and their complete understanding.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: “The Blessed One has taught the individual characteristics of the applications of mindfulness in many ways.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / bsgom pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams skye ba dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing @25b 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing yangs pa nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / bsgom pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams skye ba dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing @25b 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing yangs pa nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: He has also taught their discordances, their antidotes, their cultivation, the arising of those that have not yet arisen, the abiding of those that have arisen, their non-loss, their further arising, and their increase and abundance.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi'ang bka' stsal /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi'ang bka' stsal /
translated: He has also spoken of the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, and the limbs of awakening in the same way that he has spoken of the applications of mindfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang bka' stsal /
translated: The Blessed One has also spoken of the defining characteristics of the eightfold path of the noble ones in many ways.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / bsgom pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams skye ba dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing yangs pa nyid kyang bka' stsal la /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / bsgom pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams skye ba dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi bskyud pa dang / slar zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel zhing yangs pa nyid kyang bka' stsal la /
translated: He has also spoken of the factors that are incompatible with it, the antidotes to it, the cultivation of it, the arising of what has not yet arisen, the abiding of what has arisen, the non-loss of it, its further arising, and its increase and abundance.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa /
