translated: Therefore, I do not posit the three types of lack of own-being🔽because sentient beings superimpose the imagined nature onto the dependent nature and the perfectly established nature,🔽and they impute the characteristics of the imagined nature

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid rjes su tha snyad 'dogs te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid rjes su tha snyad 'dogs te /
translated: onto the dependent nature and the perfectly established nature.

original: ji lta ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar tha snyad btags pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems tha snyad btags pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar tha snyad btags pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems tha snyad btags pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'am /
translated: The more one imputes conventions, the more the mind that is imbued with the imputation of conventions is related to the imputation of conventions.

original: tha snyad btags pa bag la nyal gyis gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen no //
analyzed: tha snyad btags pa bag la nyal gyis gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen no //
translated: As one engages in conventional designations, the mind that is imbued with conventional designations, or the mind that is associated with conventional designations, or the mind that is latent with conventional designations, adheres to the dependent nature as having the characteristic of an imagined nature.

original: ji lta ji ltar mngon par zhen pa de lta de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen des phyi ma la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun tu bskyed de /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar mngon par zhen pa de lta de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu de dang / rkyen des phyi ma la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun tu bskyed de /
translated: As one adheres to that, due to the cause and condition of adhering to the dependent nature as having the nature of the imagined, one generates the dependent nature in the future.

original: gzhi des na /
analyzed: gzhi des na /
translated: Due to that basis,

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
translated: one becomes afflicted by the affliction of the afflictions.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang; skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang; skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kyang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They are also afflicted by the afflictions of karma and the afflictions of birth.

original: yun ring por yang na sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / yang na dud 'gro rnams sam /
analyzed: yun ring por yang na sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / yang na dud 'gro rnams sam /
translated: For a long time they will run and circle in the realms of hell beings, animals,

original: yang na yi dvags rnams sam /
analyzed: yang na yi dvags rnams sam /
translated: hungry ghosts,🔽gods,

original: yang na lha rnams sam /🔽yang na lha ma yin rnams sam /
analyzed: yang na lha rnams sam / yang na lha ma yin rnams sam /
translated: demigods,

original: yang na mi rnams kyi nang du kun tu rgyug cing 'khor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na mi rnams kyi nang du kun tu rgyug cing 'khor bar 'gyur te /
translated: and humans.

original: 'khor ba las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not transcend saṃsāra.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags /
translated: “Paramārthasamudgata,

original: de la sems can gang dag dang po nyid nas dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag dang po nyid nas dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
translated: those sentient beings who have not planted the roots of virtue from the beginning,

original: sgrib pa yongs su ma dag pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa yongs su ma dag pa /
translated: who have not purified the obscurations,

original: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa /
translated: whose continuums have not ripened,

original: mos pa mi mang @29a *//
analyzed: mos pa mi mang @29a *//
translated: who have little interest,

original: ba; bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub pa de dag la ni nga skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas chos ston te /
analyzed: ba; bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub pa de dag la ni nga skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas chos ston te /
translated: and who have not accomplished the accumulations of merit and wisdom, I teach the Dharma to them beginning with the lack of entityness of nature.

original: de dag gis chos de thos nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa nyid du shes shing mi brtan pa nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i chos nyid du shes nas 'du byed thams cad las yid sdang bar byed /🔽skyo bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis chos de thos nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa nyid du shes shing mi brtan pa nyid dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i chos nyid du shes nas 'du byed thams cad las yid sdang bar byed / skyo bar byed do //
translated: Having heard the Dharma, they understand that conditioned things that originate dependently are impermanent, unstable, unreliable, and subject to change.🔽They become disgusted with all conditioned things.

original: yid sdang bar byas /
analyzed: yid sdang bar byas /
translated: They become disgusted with all conditioned things.

original: skyo bar byas nas sdig pa las phyir zlog ste /
analyzed: skyo bar byas nas sdig pa las phyir zlog ste /
translated: Having become disgusted, they turn away from evil.

original: de dag sdig pa gang yin pa de mi byed cing dge ba la bsten par byed do //🔽dge ba la bsten pa'i rgyus dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams ni skyed do //
analyzed: de dag sdig pa gang yin pa de mi byed cing dge ba la bsten par byed do // dge ba la bsten pa'i rgyus dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams ni skyed do //
translated: They do not do what is evil, but rather they rely on what is good.🔽By relying on what is good, they produce wholesome actions that have not yet been produced.

original: sgrib pa yongs su ma byang ba rnams kyang yongs su sbyong ngo //
analyzed: sgrib pa yongs su ma byang ba rnams kyang yongs su sbyong ngo //
translated: They purify wholesome actions that have been produced.

original: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa'ang yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa'ang yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: They ripen their continuums that have not yet ripened.

original: gzhi des mos pa mang zhing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi des mos pa mang zhing bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that basis, they have much interest and they accomplish the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de dag de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bar du yang dag par 'grub mod kyi /
translated: Although they do generate roots of virtue and so on up to the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: 'on kyang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas /
analyzed: 'on kyang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gnyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas /
translated: they do not know the two types of realitylessness of production, the realitylessness of intrinsic identity and the ultimate realitylessness, just as they are.

original: 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par skyo bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par skyo bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, they do not become truly disgusted with all compounded things.

original: yang dag par @29b 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag par @29b 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not become truly free from desire.

original: yang dag par rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang dag par rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: They do not become truly liberated.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not become liberated from the defilement of the afflictions.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They do not become liberated from the defilement of karma.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: They do not become liberated from the defilement of birth.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la 'di lta ste; mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas 'di ltar 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par skyo bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la 'di lta ste; mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las brtsams nas 'di ltar 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par skyo bar bya ba dang /
translated: Moreover, those tathāgatas teach the Dharma in order to cause all beings to become disillusioned with all conditioned things,

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las yang dag par bzla ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: to become free from desire, to become liberated, to transcend the afflictive obscurations, to transcend the obscurations of actions, and to transcend the obscurations of birth, beginning with the lack of an inherent nature in terms of characteristics and the lack of an inherent nature in terms of the ultimate.

original: de dag gis chos de thos nas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de dag gis chos de thos nas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
translated: Having heard that Dharma, they do not conceive of the imagined nature in terms of the characteristic of the dependent nature. Therefore, they realize the lack of an inherent nature in terms of production.

original: de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mos par byed /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mos par byed /
translated: They believe in the ultimate naturelessness of the imagined pattern as the naturelessness of character,

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed /
translated: they discriminate it,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed cing 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed cing 'di lta ste /
translated: they understand it as it is, and they are

original: tha snyad btags pas yongs su ma bsgos pa'i shes pa tha snyad btags pa dang rjes su 'brel ba med cing tha @30a *//🔽snyad bag la nyal med pa'i shes pas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: tha snyad btags pas yongs su ma bsgos pa'i shes pa tha snyad btags pa dang rjes su 'brel ba med cing tha @30a *// snyad bag la nyal med pa'i shes pas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: not stained by the conventional designations of the consciousness that is not associated with the conventional designations,🔽and they are not stained by the latent dispositions to verbal expression.

original: tshe 'di la shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / phyi ma la rgyud yang dag par chad pas 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: tshe 'di la shes pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / phyi ma la rgyud yang dag par chad pas 'gog par byed de /
translated: By the power of their knowledge in this life and by the complete severance of their mental continuum in the next life, they attain cessation.

original: gzhi des 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par skyo ba dang / yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yang dag par rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: gzhi des 'du byed thams cad las yang dag par skyo ba dang / yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yang dag par rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: By that basis, they become completely disenchanted with all compounded things, completely free from desire, completely liberated, and they are completely purified of the afflictive obstructions, the obstructions to omniscience, and the obstructions of the afflictions.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be completely liberated from the defilement of birth.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata,

original: de la sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang lam 'di nyid dang / sgrub pa 'di nyid kyis grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang lam 'di nyid dang / sgrub pa 'di nyid kyis grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: those sentient beings who are of the śrāvaka type will also attain the unsurpassed bliss of nirvāṇa through this very path and through this very practice.

original: sems can rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs can rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang lam 'di nyid dang / sgrub pa 'di nyid kyis grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur bas 'di ni /
analyzed: sems can rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs can rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang lam 'di nyid dang / sgrub pa 'di nyid kyis grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur bas 'di ni /
translated: Sentient beings who are of the pratyekabuddha type and those who are of the tathāgata type will also attain the unsurpassed bliss of nirvāṇa through this very path and through this very practice.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i lam gcig pa yin la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i lam gcig pa yin la /
translated: This is the single pure path of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: rnam par dag pa gcig ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa gcig ste /
translated: It is the single purity.

original: gnyis pa gang yang med pas ngas de las dgongs nas theg pa gcig bu bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis pa gang yang med pas ngas de las dgongs nas theg pa gcig bu bstan te /
translated: The second is that there are no different natures of beings, so I have taught a single vehicle with that in mind.

original: sems can gyi khams na sems can @30b rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul po rnams dang / dbang po 'bring rnams dang / dbang po rnon po rnams kyi sems can gyi rigs sna tshogs dag kyang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams na sems can @30b rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul po rnams dang / dbang po 'bring rnams dang / dbang po rnon po rnams kyi sems can gyi rigs sna tshogs dag kyang med pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there are no different types of beings in the realm of sentient beings, such as those with naturally dull faculties, those with middling faculties, and those with sharp faculties.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags nyan thos kyi rigs can gang zag zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad brtson pa dang ldan par gyur kyang byang chub kyi snying po la bzhag ste /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags nyan thos kyi rigs can gang zag zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad brtson pa dang ldan par gyur kyang byang chub kyi snying po la bzhag ste /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata, the person who is of the śrāvaka type and has the single vehicle of peace cannot be caused to sit on the seat of enlightenment by all the buddhas exerting themselves.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byar mi nus so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byar mi nus so //
translated: He cannot be caused to attain unsurpassed, complete, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni snying rje shin tu chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis shin tu 'jigs pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rigs dman par kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni snying rje shin tu chung ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis shin tu 'jigs pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rigs dman par kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is naturally of a low type, since he has very little compassion and is terrified of suffering.

original: de ji ltar snying rje shin tu chung ba de bzhin du sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ji ltar snying rje shin tu chung ba de bzhin du sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as compassion is very small, so too is the activity for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyis shin tu 'jigs pa de bzhin du 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyis shin tu 'jigs pa de bzhin du 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as there is great fear of suffering, so too is there great fear of all the formative forces.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ngas ma bstan no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba la shin tu mi phyogs pa dang / 'du byed mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad la shin tu mi phyogs pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ngas ma bstan no //
translated: I do not teach that those who are greatly averse to the activity for the welfare of sentient beings and to all the formative forces are irreversible from unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhi ba'i bgrod pa gcig pu ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the solitary path of peace.

original: nyan thos byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ngas rnam grangs kyis byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan te /
analyzed: nyan thos byang chub tu yongs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ngas rnam grangs kyis byang chub sems dpa' yin par bstan te /
translated: I have taught that those śrāvakas who are irreversible from complete enlightenment are bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ltar de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol nas /
translated: Because they are liberated from the obscurations of the afflictions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis @31a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis @31a *//
translated: The Tathāgatas🔽

original: bskul na / shes bya'i sgrib pa las sems rnam par grol bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskul na / shes bya'i sgrib pa las sems rnam par grol bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are urged on by the Tathāgatas, they liberate their minds from the obscurations of the knowable.

original: de ni dang por bdag gi don la sbyor ba'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol te /
analyzed: de ni dang por bdag gi don la sbyor ba'i rnam pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol te /
translated: First, they are liberated from the obscurations of the afflictions by the aspect of application for their own benefit.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas de nyan thos kyi rigs su 'dogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas de nyan thos kyi rigs su 'dogs so //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgatas designate them as the śrāvaka type.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags /
translated: Para­mārtha­samud­gata,

original: 'di ltar nga'i chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar nga'i chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa /
translated: it is like this: in my well-expounded Dharma and Vinaya,

original: shin tu gya nom pa /
analyzed: shin tu gya nom pa /
translated: which is very refined,

original: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ston pa /
analyzed: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ston pa /
translated: which teaches with a completely pure intention,

original: chos legs par bstan pa la ni sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa'ang snang ste /
analyzed: chos legs par bstan pa la ni sems can rnams kyi mos pa'i rim pa'ang snang ste /
translated: the inclinations of sentient beings are seen in the well-taught Dharma.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags /
translated: Para­mārtha­samud­gata,

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid las dgongs nas drang ba'i don gyi mdo brjod pa'i rnam pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid las dgongs nas drang ba'i don gyi mdo brjod pa'i rnam pas 'di lta ste /
translated: the Tathāgata, intending just those three kinds of lack of own-being, with a mode of expression that has an ulterior implication, in a discourse on the ultimate, taught:🔽‘All phenomena are without own-being, without own-being, without own-being.’

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: “All phenomena are devoid of essence.

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: All phenomena are unborn.

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: They are unceasing.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: They are primordially peaceful.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes chos ston to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes chos ston to //
translated: They are by nature in a state of perfect nirvāṇa.”

original: de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa yongs su dag pa /
translated: “Among them, those beings who have given rise to great roots of virtue, who have purified obscurations,

original: rgyud yongs su smin pa /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pa /
translated: whose mindstreams have ripened,

original: mos pa mang ba /
analyzed: mos pa mang ba /
translated: who have great interest,

analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par grub pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na nga'i dgongs te bshad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing /

original: chos de la'ang chos shes par 'gyur la /

original: de la'ang aa la la /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin te /

analyzed: des ni chos thams cad legs par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes dad pa thong par 'gyur ro //
translated: He has fully and perfectly realized all dharmas.

original: de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa yongs su ma dag pa dang / rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dang / mos pa chen po ma yin pa /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa dang / sgrib pa yongs su ma dag pa dang / rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dang / mos pa chen po ma yin pa /
translated: Among them, those sentient beings who have not planted the roots of virtue, who have not purified the obscurations, whose continuums have not ripened, who do not have great interest,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par ma grub pa /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par ma grub pa /
translated: who have not accomplished the great accumulations of merit and wisdom,

analyzed: rtog pa dang sel mi nus pa /

analyzed: 'on kyang chos de la mos par byed cing dad pa'ang 'thob ste /

analyzed: mdo sde 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa zab pa zab par snang ba /

original: stong pa nyid dang ldan pa mthong bar dka' ba /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ldan pa mthong bar dka' ba /

original: rtogs par dka' ba /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba /
translated: difficult to understand,

original: brtag mi nus pa /
analyzed: brtag mi nus pa /
translated: incapable of being examined,

analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa; zhib mo brtags pa'i mkhas pa mdzangs pas rig pa yin no zhes mos par byed do //
translated: not the domain of sophistry, to be known by the wise, the learned, and the astute.

original: mdo sde de dag gi don bstan pa dag gi don bstan pa dag la bdag mi shes so snyam nas @32a *//
analyzed: mdo sde de dag gi don bstan pa dag gi don bstan pa dag la bdag mi shes so snyam nas @32a *//

analyzed: 'dug ste / 'di skad ces sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni zab /

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyang zab ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyang zab ste /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis mkhyen gyi bdag cag gis ni mi shes so //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa ni sems can rnams la mos pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The teachings of the tathāgatas are directed toward the various interests of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mkhyen pa dang gzigs pa mtha' yas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mkhyen pa dang gzigs pa mtha' yas pa yin gyi /
translated: The Tathāgatas have infinite knowledge and insight.

original: bdag cag gi shes pa dang mthong ba ni ba lang gi rjes tsam mo snyam nas /🔽de dag mdo sde de rnams la gus par byas te yi ger 'dri bar yang byed /
analyzed: bdag cag gi shes pa dang mthong ba ni ba lang gi rjes tsam mo snyam nas / de dag mdo sde de rnams la gus par byas te yi ger 'dri bar yang byed /
translated: Our knowledge and insight are like the hoofprint of an ox.🔽They will respect those sūtras and write them down.

original: yi ger bris nas 'chang bar yang byed /
analyzed: yi ger bris nas 'chang bar yang byed /
translated: Having written them down, they will keep them.

original: klog par yang byed /🔽yang dag par 'ged par yang byed /
analyzed: klog par yang byed / yang dag par 'ged par yang byed /
translated: They will read them.🔽They will disseminate them.

original: mchod par yang byed /
analyzed: mchod par yang byed /
translated: They will make offerings to them.

original: lung nod par yang byed /🔽'don par yang byed /
analyzed: lung nod par yang byed / 'don par yang byed /
translated: They will receive oral transmissions of them.🔽They will recite them.

original: kha ton du'ang byed mod kyi /
analyzed: kha ton du'ang byed mod kyi /
translated: They will chant them.

original: 'di ltar nga'i dgongs te bshad pa zab mo 'di ma rtogs pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i rnam pas sbyor bar mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar nga'i dgongs te bshad pa zab mo 'di ma rtogs pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i rnam pas sbyor bar mi nus so //
translated: But because they do not understand my profound teaching of the interpretable meaning, they will not be able to practice it by way of meditation.

original: de dag gzhi des na bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis kyang 'phel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gzhi des na bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis kyang 'phel bar 'gyur /
translated: By means of that basis, they will increase the collection of merit.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis kyang 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyis kyang 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: They will increase the collection of wisdom.

original: gong du'ang rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dag kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: gong du'ang rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dag kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Also, above, those whose continuums are not completely ripened are caused to be completely ripened.

original: ci ste sems can de dag las sems can gang dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i bar du yang dag par grub pa ma yin yang drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ste sems can de dag las sems can gang dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i bar du yang dag par grub pa ma yin yang drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la /
translated: If, from among those sentient beings, there are sentient beings who have not completely accomplished the great accumulations of merit and wisdom, and who are not straightforward and not of a straightforward nature,

original: rtog pa dang sel @32b nus la /
analyzed: rtog pa dang sel @32b nus la /
translated: but are able to understand and eliminate,

original: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na nga'i dgongs te bshad pa zab mo yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes te /
analyzed: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na nga'i dgongs te bshad pa zab mo yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes te /
translated: then, when they hear that Dharma, they do not understand the profound, just as it is, which is my intention in teaching.

original: chos de la mos kyang chos 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: chos de la mos kyang chos 'di dag thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Although they aspire to that Dharma, they think, “All these dharmas are just without an inherent nature.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ma skyes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni ma skyes pa kho na'o //
translated: All these dharmas are just non-arisen.

original: ma 'gags pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa kho na'o //
translated: They are just unceasing.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba kho na'o //
translated: They are just peace from the start.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa kho na'o zhes chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen par byed de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa kho na'o zhes chos kyi don la sgra ji bzhin kho nar mngon par zhen par byed de /
translated: They think, “All phenomena are only completely and utterly beyond suffering,” and they cling to the meaning of the teachings as if it were the literal meaning.

original: de dag gzhi des na chos thams cad la med par lta ba dang / mtshan nyid med par lta ba 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gzhi des na chos thams cad la med par lta ba dang / mtshan nyid med par lta ba 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that, they come to have the view that nothing exists and the view that nothing has any marks.

original: med par lta ba dang / mtshan nyid med par lta ba thob nas kyang thams cad la mtshan nyid thams cad kyis skur ba 'debs te /
analyzed: med par lta ba dang / mtshan nyid med par lta ba thob nas kyang thams cad la mtshan nyid thams cad kyis skur ba 'debs te /
translated: Having come to have the view that nothing exists and the view that nothing has any marks, they deny everything with every kind of denial.

original: chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la skur ba 'debs /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la skur ba 'debs /
translated: They deny the imagined reality of phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la'ang skur ba 'debs so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la'ang skur ba 'debs so //
translated: They deny the relative reality of phenomena and the perfect reality of phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam yang dag 'phags /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata,

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yod na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yod na ni /
translated: it is because if the relative and the perfect realities existed,

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rab tu shes par gyur na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rab tu shes par gyur na /
translated: They also understand the imagined identity.

original: de la gang dag gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la mtshan nyid med par mthong ba de dag gis ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la'ang skur ba btab pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la gang dag gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la mtshan nyid med par mthong ba de dag gis ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la'ang skur ba btab pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Those who see the dependent and the reality identities as identityless also deprecate the imagined identity.

original: @33a *// de lta bas na de dag ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la'ang skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya'o //🔽de dag ni nga'i chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pa yin te /🔽nga'i chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pa de dag chos la'ang chos su 'dzin /
analyzed: @33a *// de lta bas na de dag ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum char la'ang skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya'o // de dag ni nga'i chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pa yin te / nga'i chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pa de dag chos la'ang chos su 'dzin /
translated: Therefore, they are said to deprecate all three identities.🔽They have the idea that my Dharma is Dharma and the idea that what is not the goal is the goal.🔽They grasp at Dharma as Dharma and they grasp at what is not the goal as the goal.

original: don ma yin pa la'ang don du 'dzin to; ;de dag chos la mos pas dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel mod kyi /
analyzed: don ma yin pa la'ang don du 'dzin to; ;de dag chos la mos pas dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel mod kyi /
translated: Although they increase in wholesome states by their interest in Dharma,

analyzed: 'on kyang don ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pas shes rab las yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: However, because of their attachment to what is not the meaning, they fall away from wisdom.

original: shes rab las yongs su nyams na dge ba'i chos shin tu rgya che ba dang / shin tu dpag tu med pa rnams las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab las yongs su nyams na dge ba'i chos shin tu rgya che ba dang / shin tu dpag tu med pa rnams las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they fall away from wisdom, they also fall away from the vast and immeasurable wholesome dharmas.

original: de dag las gzhan dag gis chos la chos su dang / don ma yin pa la don du thos nas gang dag lta ba la dga' bar byed pa de dag ni chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pas chos la chos su dang /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan dag gis chos la chos su dang / don ma yin pa la don du thos nas gang dag lta ba la dga' bar byed pa de dag ni chos la chos su 'du shes pa dang / don ma yin pa la don du 'du shes pas chos la chos su dang /
translated: Others, having heard the Dharma as non-Dharma and what is not the meaning as the meaning, delight in views. They perceive the Dharma as the Dharma and what is not the meaning as the meaning, and they conceive the Dharma as the Dharma and what is not the meaning as the meaning.

original: don ma yin pa la don du mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don ma yin pa la don du mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: They are attached to the Dharma as the Dharma and to what is not the meaning as the meaning.

original: de dag gzhi des na de bzhin du dge ba'i chos las nyams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gzhi des na de bzhin du dge ba'i chos las nyams par rig par bya'o //
translated: By that basis, they should be known to fall away from the wholesome dharmas in the same way.

original: gang dag lta ba la dga' bar mi byed pa de dag ni de dag las chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thos shing chos rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang @33b rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa thos nas skrag cing dngangs la kun tu dbang par 'gyur zhing 'di skad ces 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang dag lta ba la dga' bar mi byed pa de dag ni de dag las chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thos shing chos rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / gzod ma nas zhi ba dang @33b rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa thos nas skrag cing dngangs la kun tu dbang par 'gyur zhing 'di skad ces 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin gyi /
translated: Those who do not delight in views, when they hear about the intrinsic realitylessness of things, the non-production and non-cessation of things, the primordial peace and natural nirvāṇa of things, will be frightened, terrified, and experience anxiety. They will say, “This is not the word of the Buddha.

original: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pa yin no zhes kyang zer zhing /
analyzed: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pa yin no zhes kyang zer zhing /
translated: This was spoken by Māra.”

original: de ltar rig nas mdo sde de dag la skur pa 'debs par byed /
analyzed: de ltar rig nas mdo sde de dag la skur pa 'debs par byed /
translated: Knowing this, they will disparage those sūtras.

original: spong bar byed /🔽mi bsngags pa rjod par byed /
analyzed: spong bar byed / mi bsngags pa rjod par byed /
translated: They will reject them.🔽They will speak unfavorably about them.

original: ngan du rjod par byed /
analyzed: ngan du rjod par byed /

analyzed: gzhi des na phongs pa chen po 'thob par 'gyur zhing las kyi sgrib pa chen pos kyang reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, they will attain great misfortune and will be touched by great karmic obscurations.”

original: gzhi des kyang gang dag skye bo phal po che la las kyi sgrib pa chen po 'thob pas slu bar byed pa /
analyzed: gzhi des kyang gang dag skye bo phal po che la las kyi sgrib pa chen po 'thob pas slu bar byed pa /
translated: They deceive many people, causing them to accumulate great karmic obscurations.

original: mtshan nyid thams cad med par lta zhing don ma yin pa don du ston par byed pa de dag ni las kyi sgrib pa chen po dang ldan par nga smra'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad med par lta zhing don ma yin pa don du ston par byed pa de dag ni las kyi sgrib pa chen po dang ldan par nga smra'o //

original: don dam pa yang dag 'phags /
analyzed: don dam pa yang dag 'phags /
translated: Paramārthasamudgata,

analyzed: de la sems can gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed / sgrib pa yongs su ma dag /

analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma smin /
translated: whose continuums have not ripened,

original: mos pa mi mang /
analyzed: mos pa mi mang /
translated: who have no interest,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub cing /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par ma grub cing /
translated: who have not accomplished the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

analyzed: drang po dang drang po'i rang bzhin can ma yin la rtog pa dang sel mi nus la /
translated: who are not upright and have not the nature of uprightness, who are unable to discern and eliminate,

analyzed: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par gnas pa de dag gis ni chos de thos na /
translated: and who abide in the view that their own view is supreme, when they hear that Dharma,

analyzed: nga'i dgongs te bshad pa'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes shing chos de la mos par yang mi 'gyur la /

analyzed: chos la'ang chos ma yin pa @34a *//

analyzed: 'di skad ces 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin gyi /
translated: They will say, ‘This is not the word of the Buddha.

analyzed: 'di ni bdud kyis smras pa yin no zhes kyang zer zhing /
translated: This was spoken by Māra.’

analyzed: de ltar rig nas mdo sde dag la skur pa 'debs par byed /
translated: Knowing this, they will disparage the sūtras,

original: spong bar byed /🔽mi bsngags pa rjod par byed /
analyzed: spong bar byed / mi bsngags pa rjod par byed /
translated: reject them,🔽speak ill of them,

original: ngan du rjod par byed cing lhad kyang 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: ngan du rjod par byed cing lhad kyang 'jug par byed de /
translated: and introduce corruption.

analyzed: rnam grangs du mar mdo sde de dag spang ba dang / chud gzan pa dang / rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir zhugs shing de la mos pa'i gang zag rnams la'ang dgrar 'du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: In many ways, they will have entered into the abandonment, the destruction, and the annihilation of those sūtras, and they will have the perception that those persons who are devoted to them are their enemies.

analyzed: de dag ni dang po nyid nas kyang las kyi sgrib pas bsgribs pa yin la /
translated: From the very beginning, they will be obscured by the obscurations of karma.

original: gzhi des kyang yang las kyi sgrib pa de lta bus sgrib pa byed de /
analyzed: gzhi des kyang yang las kyi sgrib pa de lta bus sgrib pa byed de /

original: las kyi sgrib pa de'i dang po ni gdags par sla'i /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to him:

original: don dam yang dag 'phags /🔽'di ni don dam pa'i nges pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags / 'di ni don dam pa'i nges pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: “Paramārthasamudgata,🔽this is the teaching of the definitive meaning of the ultimate.

original: 'di don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya bar gzung zhig @40a *//
analyzed: 'di don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya bar gzung zhig @40a *//
translated: Remember it as the Teaching of the Definitive Meaning of the Ultimate.

original: don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: don dam pa nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: When this teaching of the ultimate truth was being given, six hundred thousand beings gave rise to the mind of unexcelled and perfect awakening.

original: nyan thos sum 'bum ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: nyan thos sum 'bum ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: Three hundred thousand śrāvakas purified the eye of Dharma with regard to phenomena, free from dust and uncontaminated.

original: nyan thos 'bum lnga khri ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo; ;byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: nyan thos 'bum lnga khri ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo; ;byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: One hundred fifty thousand śrāvakas liberated their minds from defilements without grasping. Seventy-five thousand bodhisattvas attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: don dam yang dag 'phags kyi le'u ste bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: don dam yang dag 'phags kyi le'u ste bdun pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the seventh chapter of the Bodhisattva King of the Teachings’ Questions.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Maitreya asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ci la gnas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ci la gnas /
translated: where do bodhisattvas dwell?

original: ci la brten te theg pa chen po la zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom par bgyid lags /
analyzed: ci la brten te theg pa chen po la zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom par bgyid lags /
translated: On what do they rely in order to cultivate śamatha and vipaśyanā in the Great Vehicle?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: byams pa / chos gdags pa rnam par bzhag pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam mi gtong ba la gnas shing brten cing brten nas so //
analyzed: byams pa / chos gdags pa rnam par bzhag pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam mi gtong ba la gnas shing brten cing brten nas so //
translated: Maitreya, it is based on and supported by the establishment of the designation of phenomena and not abandoning the aspiration for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bhagavān has taught that the four things that are the objects of observation of śamatha and vipaśyanā are

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa'o zhes gang dag @40b bstan pa de la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa'o zhes gang dag @40b bstan pa de la /
translated: the imagined image, the non-imagined image, the limit of entities, and the complete accomplishment of the purpose.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: du zhig zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa lags /
analyzed: du zhig zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa lags /
translated: how many are the objects of observation of śamatha?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: gcig ste / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gcig ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: One,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: namely, the non-imagined image.

original: du zhig lhag mthong gi dmigs pa lags /
analyzed: du zhig lhag mthong gi dmigs pa lags /
translated: How many are the objects of observation of vipaśyanā?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: gcig kho na ste /
translated: One alone,🔽namely, the imagined image.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: It is a conceptual image.

original: du zhig de gnyis ka'i dmigs pa lags /
analyzed: du zhig de gnyis ka'i dmigs pa lags /
translated: How many are the objects of both?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
translated: Two:

original: dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' dang / dgos pa yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: the limit of existence and the accomplishment of purpose.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi po de dag la brten cing gnas nas ji ltar zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar bgyid ba dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i dngos po bzhi po de dag la brten cing gnas nas ji ltar zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar bgyid ba dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa lags /
translated: how do bodhisattvas, relying on and abiding in those four things that are the objects of śamatha and vipaśyanā, seek śamatha and become skilled in vipaśyanā?

original: bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Lord said:

original: byams pa / ngas chos gdags pa rnam par bzhag pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byams pa / ngas chos gdags pa rnam par bzhag pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Maitreya, I have set forth this presentation of the designations of phenomena:

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /
translated: the class of sūtras, the class of melodious praises, the class of prophecies, the class of verses, the class of expressions of resolve, the class of narratives, the class of explanations, the class of former events, the class of extensive teachings, and the class of marvelous events.

original: skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde gang dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad pa de dag byang chub sems dpas legs par thos /🔽legs par bzung /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde gang dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad pa de dag byang chub sems dpas legs par thos / legs par bzung /
translated: the categories of the Jātaka, the Vaipulya, the Adbhutadharma, and the Upadeśa that are explained to the bodhisattvas.🔽They have received them well,

original: kha ton byang bar byas /
analyzed: kha ton byang bar byas /
translated: they have mastered them,

original: yid kyis legs par brtags /
analyzed: yid kyis legs par brtags /
translated: they have examined them with the mind,🔽they have understood them well by seeing.

original: @41a *// mthong pas shin tu rtogs par byas nas de gcig pu dben par 'dug ste /
analyzed: @41a *// mthong pas shin tu rtogs par byas nas de gcig pu dben par 'dug ste /
translated: Then, alone and secluded,

original: nang du yang dag bzhag nas ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos de dag yid la byed cing /
analyzed: nang du yang dag bzhag nas ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos de dag yid la byed cing /
translated: having entered into the inner good abidings, they attend to those dharmas as they have been well considered.

original: sems gang gis yid la byed pa'i sems de nang du rgyun chags su yid la byed pas yid la byed do //
analyzed: sems gang gis yid la byed pa'i sems de nang du rgyun chags su yid la byed pas yid la byed do //
translated: They attend to them by attending to the mind that attends to them, by attending to the mind that attends to them continuously.

original: de ltar zhugs shing de la lan mang du gnas pa de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs shing de la lan mang du gnas pa de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: The physical and mental pliancy that arise in one who has entered and abides frequently in this way is called “calming.”

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas yongs su tshol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva seeks calming.

original: de lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa de thos nas de nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: de lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa de thos nas de nyid la gnas te /
translated: Having heard about physical and mental pliancy, he abides in just that.

original: sems kyi rnam pa spangs nas ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor rtog par byed /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa spangs nas ji ltar bsams pa'i chos de dag nyid nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du so sor rtog par byed /
translated: Having abandoned the mode of mental activity, he reflects on those very dharmas that he has contemplated, in the form of images that are the domain of meditative concentration.

original: mos par byed do //
analyzed: mos par byed do //
translated: He believes in them.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de dag la shes bya'i don de rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod pa dang / bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de dag la shes bya'i don de rnam par 'byed pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / yongs su rtog pa dang / yongs su dpyod pa dang / bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang /
translated: In this way, he discerns, fully discerns, fully considers, fully investigates, fully assents to, and fully believes in the meaning of the object of knowledge in those images that are the domain of meditative concentration.

original: bye brag 'byed pa dang / lta ba dang / rtog pa gang yin ba de ni lhag mthong zhes bya ste; de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lhag mthong la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag 'byed pa dang / lta ba dang / rtog pa gang yin ba de ni lhag mthong zhes bya ste; de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' lhag mthong la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: The discernment of the characteristics of the object, the discernment of the distinctions, the discernment of the view, and the discernment of the investigation are called insight.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Thus, Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de la sems la dmigs pa'i sems nang du yid la @41b bgyid pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de la sems la dmigs pa'i sems nang du yid la @41b bgyid pa na /
translated: when a bodhisattva who is a beginner is paying attention to the mind that is focused on the mind,

original: ji srid du lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob pa de'i bar du yid la bgyid pa de la ci zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ji srid du lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob pa de'i bar du yid la bgyid pa de la ci zhes bgyi /
translated: for as long as he has not attained physical and mental pliancy, what is that attention called?

original: byams pa / zhi gnas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byams pa / zhi gnas ni ma yin te /
translated: Maitreya, it is not serenity,

original: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: but it should be said to be associated with the aspiration that is conducive to serenity.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ji srid du lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob pa de'i bar du ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos de dag nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du yid la bgyid pa'i yid la bgyid pa de la
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ji srid du lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa ma thob pa de'i bar du ji ltar legs par bsams pa'i chos de dag nang du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan du yid la bgyid pa'i yid la bgyid pa de la
translated: Maitreya, as long as a bodhisattva has not attained physical and mental pliancy, the mental attention that mentally attends to those phenomena that are the objects of meditation of samādhi as representations internally, in accordance with how they have been contemplated,

original: ci zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ci zhes bgyi /
translated: is what?

original: byams pa / lhag mthong ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byams pa / lhag mthong ni ma yin te /
translated: Maitreya, it is not vipaśyanā,

original: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa'i mos pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: but it should be called “the attention that is concomitant with the aspiration that is in harmony with vipaśyanā.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽zhi gnas kyi lam dang / lhag mthong gi lam tha dad ces bgyi'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / zhi gnas kyi lam dang / lhag mthong gi lam tha dad ces bgyi'am /
translated: Blessed One,

original: tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi /
translated: is the path of śamatha and the path of vipaśyanā said to be different or not different?

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽byams pa / tha dad pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / byams pa / tha dad pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: “Maitreya, they are said to be neither different nor not different.

original: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not different?

original: lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi dmigs pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because vipaśyanā focuses on the mind that is the object of meditation of śamatha.

original: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not different?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has a conceptual image as its object.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam par lta bar bgyid pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gang lags bde ci lags /🔽sems de dang tha dad pa zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: rnam par lta bar bgyid pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gang lags bde ci lags / sems de dang tha dad pa zhes bgyi'am /
translated: what is the image that is the domain of the concentration of discernment?

original: tha dad @42a *//
analyzed: tha dad @42a *//
translated: Is it the same as the mind or is it different?

original: pa ma lags zhes bgyi /
analyzed: pa ma lags zhes bgyi /
translated: Is it not different?

original: byams pa / tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa / tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, it is not different.

original: ci'i phyir tha dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not different?

original: gzugs brnyan de rnam par rig pa com du zad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de rnam par rig pa com du zad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that image is merely an appearance of consciousness.

original: byams pa / rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnams par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: byams pa / rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnams par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin no zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: Maitreya, I have explained that consciousness is distinguished by the mere appearance of its object.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de gal te gzugs sems de las tha dad pa ma lags na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de gal te gzugs sems de las tha dad pa ma lags na /
translated: if the image that is the domain of concentration is not different from that form,

original: sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid la ji ltar rtog par bgyid lags /
analyzed: sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid la ji ltar rtog par bgyid lags /
translated: How does the mind itself conceive of the mind itself?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: byams pa / de la chos gang yang chos gang la'ang rtog par mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: byams pa / de la chos gang yang chos gang la'ang rtog par mi byed mod kyi /
translated: “Maitreya, no phenomenon conceives of any phenomenon.

original: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de de ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de de ltar snang ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, the mind that has arisen in that way appears in that way.

original: byams pa / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byams pa / 'di lta ste /
translated: Maitreya, it is like this:

original: dper na / gzugs la brten nas me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la gzugs nyid mthong yang gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems te /
analyzed: dper na / gzugs la brten nas me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu yongs su dag pa la gzugs nyid mthong yang gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems te /
translated: Based on form, in a very clear mirror, one sees the form itself, but thinks, ‘I see a reflection.’

original: de la gzugs de dang / gzugs brnyan snang ba de don tha dad par snang ngo //
analyzed: de la gzugs de dang / gzugs brnyan snang ba de don tha dad par snang ngo //
translated: The form and the appearance of the reflection appear as different objects.

original: de bzhin du de ltar skyes pa'i sems de dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'ang de las don gzhan yin pa lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ltar skyes pa'i sems de dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'ang de las don gzhan yin pa lta bur snang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the mind that has arisen in that way and the so-called reflection that is the object of concentration appear as if they were different objects.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sems can rnams kyi gzugs la sogs par snang ba sems kyi gzugs brnyan rang bzhin du gnas pa gang lags pa de'ang sems de dang tha dad @42b pa ma lags zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi gzugs la sogs par snang ba sems kyi gzugs brnyan rang bzhin du gnas pa gang lags pa de'ang sems de dang tha dad @42b pa ma lags zhes bgyi'am /
translated: “Are the reflections of form and so on that appear to sentient beings, which are the natural abiding of the mind, also not different from that mind?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: byams pa / tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa / tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya ste /
translated: “Maitreya, they are not different.

original: byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni gzugs brnyan de dag la rnam par rig pa tsam de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pas phyin ci log tu sems so //
analyzed: byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni gzugs brnyan de dag la rnam par rig pa tsam de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pas phyin ci log tu sems so //
translated: However, childish beings with distorted minds do not know that those reflections are just consciousness itself, and so they think in distorted ways about them.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' ji tsam gyis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' ji tsam gyis na /
translated: Blessed One,🔽to what extent

original: gcig tu lhag mthong sgom pa lags /
analyzed: gcig tu lhag mthong sgom pa lags /
translated: do bodhisattvas cultivate insight exclusively?🔽The Blessed One said:

original: bka' stsal pa; gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas sems kyi mtshan nyid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa; gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas sems kyi mtshan nyid la byed pa'o //
translated: When they engage with the characteristics of the mind through continuous mental attention.

original: ji tsam gyis na gcig tu zhi gnas bsgom pa lags /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na gcig tu zhi gnas bsgom pa lags /
translated: To what extent do they cultivate śamatha exclusively?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas bar chad med pa'i sems yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyun chags su yid la byed pas bar chad med pa'i sems yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is the uninterrupted attention of the mind by means of continuous attention.

original: ji tsam gyis na zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par 'gyur te mnyam par zung du 'jug pa lags /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gnyis 'dres par 'gyur te mnyam par zung du 'jug pa lags /

original: bka' stsal pa; gang gi tshe sems rtse gcig pa nyid yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa; gang gi tshe sems rtse gcig pa nyid yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān replied, “When there is the attention of the mind’s one-pointedness.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: sems kyi mtshan ma gang lags /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan ma gang lags /

analyzed: byams pa / lhag mthong gi dmigs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa'o //
translated: Maitreya, they are the object of vipaśyanā, the object of the domain of samādhi, and the conceptual image.

original: bar chad ma mchis pa'i sems gang lags /
analyzed: bar chad ma mchis pa'i sems gang lags /

original: byams pa / zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa / zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i sems gang yin pa'o //
translated: Maitreya, it is the mind that focuses on the image, the object of śamatha.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang lags /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid gang lags /
translated: What is the mind’s one-pointedness?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de la 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam yin no zhes bya bar rtogs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan de la 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam yin no zhes bya bar rtogs te /
translated: It is the realization that the image, the object of samādhi, is merely consciousness.

original: de rtogs @43a *//
analyzed: de rtogs @43a *//

original: nas de bzhin nyid du yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nas de bzhin nyid du yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mental attention to suchness that has been realized.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavan,

original: lhag mthong la rnam pa du mchis /
analyzed: lhag mthong la rnam pa du mchis /
translated: how many kinds of vipaśyanā are there?

original: byams pa / rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byams pa / rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: mtshan ma las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba las byung ba dang / so sor rtog pa las byung ba'o //
translated: that which arises from signs, that which arises from thorough searching, and that which arises from discernment.

original: mtshan ma las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma las byung ba gang zhe na /

original: yongs su tshol ba las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba las byung ba gang zhe na /

original: so sor rtog pa las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa las byung ba gang zhe na /

original: de dang der shes rab kyis shin tu legs par rtogs pa'i chos rnams la rnam par grol bas shin tu legs par bde ba la reg par bya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa'i lhag mthong gang yin pa'o //

original: zhi gnas la rnam pa du mchis /
analyzed: zhi gnas la rnam pa du mchis /

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sems de'i rjes su 'brang bas de'ang rnam pa gsum du brjod par bya'o //

translated: Maitreya, there are eight kinds of serenity: the first concentration, the second concentration, the third concentration, the fourth concentration, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong de gang la rtogs shing gang la 'thob par 'tshal bar bgyi lags /
