original: bka' stsal pa; byams pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa; byams pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Maitreya,

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la ni rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la ni rtogs pa yin la /
translated: the first bhūmi, Very Joyful, is the realization,

original: sa gsum pa 'od byed pa la ni thob par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sa gsum pa 'od byed pa la ni thob par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the third ground, The Luminous, is the attainment of this.

original: byams pa / de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: byams pa / de lta mod kyi /
translated: Maitreya, it is just so.

original: byang chub sems dpa' @45b las dang po pas kyang de la rjes su bslab cing yid la bya bar mi gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @45b las dang po pas kyang de la rjes su bslab cing yid la bya bar mi gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Even a beginner bodhisattva should train in this and not give up mental attention to it.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba lags /
translated: how does śamatha and vipaśyanā become a samādhi that is both analytical and has analysis?

original: ji ltar rtog pa ma mchis shing dpyod pa tsam du 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar rtog pa ma mchis shing dpyod pa tsam du 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How does it become without analysis but with only analysis?

original: ji ltar na rtog pa ma mchis pa dang dpyod pa ma mchis par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na rtog pa ma mchis pa dang dpyod pa ma mchis par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: How does it become without analysis and without analysis?

original: byams pa / ji ltar bzung zhing brtags pa dang / dpyad pa'i chos rnams la de dag gi mtshan ma gsal zhing rags pa myong ba'i rjes su dpyod pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: byams pa / ji ltar bzung zhing brtags pa dang / dpyad pa'i chos rnams la de dag gi mtshan ma gsal zhing rags pa myong ba'i rjes su dpyod pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Maitreya, śamatha and vipaśyanā that is the experience of the clear and coarse characteristics of those phenomena that have been apprehended, examined, and analyzed

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: It is concentration that is accompanied by both applied and sustained thought.

original: de dag nyid kyi mtshan ma gsal zhing rags pa myong ba'i rjes su dpyod pa ma yin mod kyi /🔽'on kyang de snang ba 'ol byi dran pa tsam phra mo myong ba'i rjes su dpyod pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi mtshan ma gsal zhing rags pa myong ba'i rjes su dpyod pa ma yin mod kyi / 'on kyang de snang ba 'ol byi dran pa tsam phra mo myong ba'i rjes su dpyod pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: Although one does not investigate the obvious and gross characteristics of those very objects,🔽nevertheless, one does investigate the subtle experience of the mere appearance of those objects in memory. That is the serenity and insight that are concentration accompanied by sustained thought but not by applied thought.🔽That is the concentration that is accompanied by neither applied nor sustained thought.

original: de dag gi mtshan ma la thams cad kyi thams cad du lhun gyis grub par chos myong ba yid la byed pas rnam par dpyod pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan ma la thams cad kyi thams cad du lhun gyis grub par chos myong ba yid la byed pas rnam par dpyod pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: That is the concentration that is accompanied by neither applied nor sustained thought.

original: byams pa / yang yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang @46a *//🔽bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: byams pa / yang yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gang yin pa de ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang @46a *// bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: Maitreya, the śamatha and vipaśyanā that arise from thorough searching are samādhis that are both with discursive thought and with analytical thought.

original: so sor rtog pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: The śamatha and vipaśyanā that arise from discernment are samādhis that are without discursive thought but with only analytical thought.

original: 'dres ba'i chos la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: 'dres ba'i chos la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: The śamatha and vipaśyanā that focus on combined phenomena are samādhis that are without either discursive thought or analytical thought.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags /🔽rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang lags /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags / rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan ni gang lags /
translated: what are the characteristics of śamatha?🔽What are the characteristics of exertion?

original: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan ni gang lags /
translated: What are the characteristics of equanimity?

original: byams pa / sems rgod pa'am /
analyzed: byams pa / sems rgod pa'am /
translated: Maitreya, when the mind is agitated or

original: rgod du dogs pa na /
analyzed: rgod du dogs pa na /
translated: you fear it will become agitated,

original: kun tu skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / bar chad med pa'i sems de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun tu skyo bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / bar chad med pa'i sems de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental attention to the factors that are conducive to complete disenchantment and to the uninterrupted mind is called the reason for calm abiding.

original: byams pa / sems bying ngam /
analyzed: byams pa / sems bying ngam /
translated: Maitreya, when the mind is sinking or

original: bying du dogs pa na /
analyzed: bying du dogs pa na /
translated: is in danger of sinking,

original: mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / sems kyi mtshan ma de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang mthun pa'i chos rnams dang / sems kyi mtshan ma de yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: the mental attention to the factors that are conducive to manifest delight and to the sign of the mind is called the reason for complete acceptance.

original: byams pa / zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'am /
analyzed: byams pa / zhi gnas la gcig tu nges pa'am /
translated: Maitreya, whether it is the path of calm abiding that is definite,

original: lhag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'am /
analyzed: lhag mthong la gcig tu nges pa'am /
translated: or the path of special insight that is definite,

original: zung du 'brel ba'i lam yang rung ste /
analyzed: zung du 'brel ba'i lam yang rung ste /
translated: or the path that is a union of the two,

original: de gnyis ka'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa la sems rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa na yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa la sems rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa na yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: when the mind enters its natural state without being afflicted by the secondary afflictions of either of the two, the spontaneous mental attention is called the reason for equanimity.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa /
translated: The bodhisattva cultivates serenity and insight.🔽“The bodhisattva’s discernment of factors and discernment of meaning

original: @46b chos so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / don so sor yang dag par rig pa lags na /
analyzed: @46b chos so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / don so sor yang dag par rig pa lags na /
translated: are based on the discernment of factors and the discernment of meaning.

original: ji ltar chos so sor yang dag par rig pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar chos so sor yang dag par rig pa lags /
translated: What is the discernment of factors?

original: ji ltar don so sor yang dag par rig pa lags byams pa /
analyzed: ji ltar don so sor yang dag par rig pa lags byams pa /
translated: What is the discernment of meaning?

original: rnam pa lngas so sor yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas so sor yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: “Maitreya, there are five kinds of discernment:

original: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge dang / so so ba dang / bsdus pas so //
analyzed: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge dang / so so ba dang / bsdus pas so //
translated: discernment of name, of phrase, of syllable, of individual character, and of universal character.

original: ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming gang zhe na /
translated: “What is discernment of name?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag gi ming du bya bar btags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la ngo bo nyid dang / bye brag gi ming du bya bar btags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the designation of the intrinsic and specific names of the factors of defilement and purification.

original: tshig gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gang zhe na /
translated: “What is discernment of phrase?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ba'i don rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir gnas dang rten ming de dag nyid kyi tshogs la brten pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ba'i don rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir gnas dang rten ming de dag nyid kyi tshogs la brten pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the collection of those names that are the basis and support for the expression of the meaning of defilement and purification.🔽“What is discernment of syllable?

original: yi ge gang zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge gang zhe na /
translated: What is a letter?

original: de gnyis ka'i gnas kyi yig 'bru gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i gnas kyi yig 'bru gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the syllable which is the basis of those two.

original: de dag so so las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag so so las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the analytical knowledge of the teaching?

original: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so so yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so so yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the analytical knowledge which has for its object the unmixed teachings.

original: bsdus pa las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsdus pa las so so yang dag par rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the analytical knowledge of inspired speech?

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so so yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas so so yang dag par rig pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the analytical knowledge which has for its object the mixed teachings.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdu na chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdu na chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When all these analytical knowledges are combined, they are called the analytical knowledge of the teaching.

original: de ltar na chos so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
translated: Such is the analytical knowledge of the teaching.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa bcus don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /🔽ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du @47a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa bcus don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /🔽ji snyed yod pa nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin du @47a *//
translated: The bodhisattvas' analytical knowledge of the teaching is tenfold.🔽It is the knowledge of the teaching of the Dharma which is the totality of the teachings of the vehicles.

original: yod pa nyid dang / 'dzin pa'i don dang / gzung ba'i don dang / gnas pa'i don dang / longs spyod kyi don dang / phyin ci log gi don dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don dang /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang / 'dzin pa'i don dang / gzung ba'i don dang / gnas pa'i don dang / longs spyod kyi don dang / phyin ci log gi don dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don dang /
translated: the meaning of existence, the meaning of apprehension, the meaning of the apprehended, the meaning of the basis, the meaning of enjoyment, the meaning of error, the meaning of non-error, the meaning of affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i don gyis so //
translated: and the meaning of purification.

original: byams pa / de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la rnam pa rab tu dbye ba thams cad kyi mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni ji snyed yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byams pa / de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la rnam pa rab tu dbye ba thams cad kyi mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni ji snyed yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Maitreya, the ultimate of all the divisions of the dharmas of affliction and purification is the meaning of existence.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: phung po rnams kyi ni grangs lngas so //🔽nang gi skye mched rnams kyi ni grangs drug gis so //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi ni grangs lngas so // nang gi skye mched rnams kyi ni grangs drug gis so //
translated: The aggregates are five in number.🔽The internal sense bases are six in number.

original: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi'ang grangs drug kho nas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi'ang grangs drug kho nas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The external sense bases are also six in number.

original: byams pa / de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byams pa / de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Maitreya, the suchness of those very phenomena that are afflicted and purified is the way things are.

original: de'ang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de'ang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: That is sevenfold:

original: 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid ni 'du byed rnams kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid ni 'du byed rnams kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of arising is the absence of a beginning and end of formations.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad kyi gang zag bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni chos thams cad kyi gang zag bdag med pa dang / chos bdag med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of characteristics is the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena of all phenomena.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'du byed rnams rnam par rig pa nyid gang yin pa'o //🔽gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'du byed rnams rnam par rig pa nyid gang yin pa'o // gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of representations is the mere representation of formations.🔽The suchness of abiding is what I have taught as the truth of suffering.

original: log par sgrub pa'i @47b de bzhin nyid ni ngas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa'i @47b de bzhin nyid ni ngas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of wrong practice is what I have taught as the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of purification is the truth of cessation that I have taught.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas la ma gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni ngas la ma gyi bden pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The suchness of right practice is the truth of the path that I have taught.

original: byams pa / de la 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / log par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni sems can thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: byams pa / de la 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / log par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni sems can thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: Maitreya, in this regard, all sentient beings are the same and equal in terms of the suchness of arising, the suchness of abiding, and the suchness of wrong practice.

original: byams pa / de la mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni chos thams cad dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: byams pa / de la mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dang / rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni chos thams cad dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: Maitreya, in this regard, all phenomena are the same and equal in terms of the suchness of characteristics and the suchness of representations.

original: byams pa / rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni nyan thos kyi byang chub gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gang yin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yin pa'i byang chub thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: byams pa / rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des ni nyan thos kyi byang chub gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gang yin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yin pa'i byang chub thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: Maitreya, the suchness of purification is the same for all enlightenments—the enlightenment of the śrāvakas, the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas, and the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byams pa / de la yang dag par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid des ni thos pa thams cad 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi bsdus pa'i shes rab mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: byams pa / de la yang dag par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid des ni thos pa thams cad 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi bsdus pa'i shes rab mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: Maitreya, the suchness of accomplishment is the same for all wisdom that is included in śamatha and vipaśyanā, which are focused on the Dharma that is mixed with all that is heard.

original: byams pa / de la 'dzin pa'i don ni skye mched gzugs can lnga dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams @48a *//
analyzed: byams pa / de la 'dzin pa'i don ni skye mched gzugs can lnga dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams @48a *//
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of grasping is the five sense faculties, the mind, the mental faculty, consciousness, and the phenomena that arise from the mind.

original: so; ;byams pa /
analyzed: so; ;byams pa /
translated: Maitreya,

original: de la gzung ba'i don ni phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag yin no //
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i don ni phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag yin no //
translated: the meaning of the apprehended is the six external sense bases.

original: byams pa / yang 'dzin pa'i don gang yin pa de ni gzung ba'i don kyang yin no; ;byams pa /
analyzed: byams pa / yang 'dzin pa'i don gang yin pa de ni gzung ba'i don kyang yin no; ;byams pa /
translated: Maitreya,

original: de la gnas kyi don ni 'jig rten gyi khams gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas kyi don ni 'jig rten gyi khams gang yin pa ste /
translated: the meaning of ‘abode’ is the world systems.

original: gang la gnas na sems can gyi khams snang ba'o //
analyzed: gang la gnas na sems can gyi khams snang ba'o //
translated: Abiding in that, the realm of sentient beings appears.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: grong tshigs dang / grong tshigs brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / rgya mtsho la thug pa'i sa dang / de brgya dang / de 'bum dang / dzambu'i gling dang / de brgyad dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang /
analyzed: grong tshigs dang / grong tshigs brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / rgya mtsho la thug pa'i sa dang / de brgya dang / de 'bum dang / dzambu'i gling dang / de brgyad dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang /
translated: a village, a hundred villages, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those, the land up to the ocean, a hundred of those, a hundred thousand of those, Jambudvīpa, a hundred of those, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those,

original: gling bzhi pa dang; de brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / de brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang; de brgya dang /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dang; de brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / de brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang; de brgya dang /
translated: a four-continent world system, a hundred of those, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those, a world system of a billion worlds, a hundred of those, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those, a world system of two billion worlds, a hundred of those,

original: de stong dang / de 'bum dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / de bye ba dang / de bye ba phrag brgya dang; de bye ba phrag stong dang / de bye ba phrag 'bum dang /
analyzed: de stong dang / de 'bum dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de brgya dang / de stong dang / de 'bum dang / de bye ba dang / de bye ba phrag brgya dang; de bye ba phrag stong dang / de bye ba phrag 'bum dang /
translated: a hundred of those, a thousand of those, a hundred thousand of those, a million of those, a billion of those, a trillion of those, a quintillion of those, a hundred quintillion of those, a thousand quintillion of those, a hundred thousand quintillion of those,

original: de grangs med pa dang / de grangs med pa phrag brgya dang / de grangs med pa phrag stong dang / de grangs med pa phrag 'bum dang / phyogs bcu dag gi 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa phrag 'bum gyi rdul phra rab @48b kyi rdul snyed dag go /
analyzed: de grangs med pa dang / de grangs med pa phrag brgya dang / de grangs med pa phrag stong dang / de grangs med pa phrag 'bum dang / phyogs bcu dag gi 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa phrag 'bum gyi rdul phra rab @48b kyi rdul snyed dag go /
translated: an incalculable number of those, a hundred incalculable numbers of those, a thousand incalculable numbers of those, a hundred thousand incalculable numbers of those, and as many as there are atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya of great trichiliocosms in the ten directions.

original: byams pa / de la longs spyod kyi don ni yongs su spyad par bya ba'i phyir ngas sems can rnams kyi yongs su bzung ba dang / yo byad bstan pa gang dag yin pa rnams so; ;byams pa /
analyzed: byams pa / de la longs spyod kyi don ni yongs su spyad par bya ba'i phyir ngas sems can rnams kyi yongs su bzung ba dang / yo byad bstan pa gang dag yin pa rnams so; ;byams pa /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of enjoyment is the objects of enjoyment that I have taught for the appropriation and use of sentient beings.

original: de la phyin ci log gi don ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i don de dag nyid la mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log dang; sdug bsngal la bde ba dang /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log gi don ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i don de dag nyid la mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log dang; sdug bsngal la bde ba dang /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of error is the error of perception, the error of mind, and the error of view that arise in relation to those objects of appropriation, etc. , which are impermanent but are perceived as permanent, painful but are perceived as pleasurable,

original: mi gtsang pa la gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang pa la gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log gang yin pa'o //
translated: impure but are perceived as pure, and selfless but are perceived as having a self.

original: byams pa / de la phyin ci ma log pa'i don ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa / de la phyin ci ma log pa'i don ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of non-error is the opposite of that,

original: de'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and should be understood as the antidote to that.

original: byams pa / de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byams pa / de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of affliction is threefold:

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions of the three realms, the afflictions of karma, and the afflictions of birth.

original: byams pa / de la rnam par byang ba'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang dag yin pa rnams te /
analyzed: byams pa / de la rnam par byang ba'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang dag yin pa rnams te /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of purification is the dharmas that are factors of enlightenment, in order to be free from just those three kinds of afflictions.

original: byams pa / rnam pa bcu po de dag gis don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa / rnam pa bcu po de dag gis don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that all meanings are included in these ten kinds.

original: byams pa / yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa lngas don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa / yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa lngas don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: “Maitreya, again, the bodhisattvas’ discernment of meaning is fivefold.

original: don rnam pa lnga gang zhe @49a *//
analyzed: don rnam pa lnga gang zhe @49a *//
translated: What are the five kinds of meaning?

original: na; yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / de rab tu rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: na; yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / de rab tu rig par byed pa'o //
translated: and the thorough knowledge of that.

original: byams pa / de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni shes bya thams cad yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa / de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni shes bya thams cad yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Maitreya, the things that are to be understood should be regarded as all objects of knowledge.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are, for example,

original: phung po rnams zhes bya ba'am /🔽nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams zhes bya ba'am / nang gi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am /
translated: called the aggregates,🔽called the inner sense spheres,

original: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams zhes bya ba'am /
translated: called the outer sense spheres,

original: de lta bu la sogs pa dag go /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa dag go /
translated: and so forth.

original: byams pa / de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni rnam pa ji snyed kyis shes bya de ji lta ba bzhin shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: byams pa / de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni rnam pa ji snyed kyis shes bya de ji lta ba bzhin shes par bya ba ste /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning that is to be understood is the way that object of knowledge is to be understood according to its nature.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is, for example,

original: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dang / skyon dang / yon tan dang / rkyen dang / dus dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang; 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nad la sogs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa dang / skyon dang / yon tan dang / rkyen dang / dus dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang; 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nad la sogs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: faults and qualities, conditions, time, the characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating, illness and so on, suffering, origination and so on,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / bsdu ba dang / dbye ba dang / mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / bris te lan gdab pa dang / gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / bsdu ba dang / dbye ba dang / mgo gcig tu lan gdab pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / bris te lan gdab pa dang / gzhag pa dang /
translated: suchness, the perfect end, the realm of phenomena, inclusion, division, answering categorically, analysis, answering through a counter-question, setting aside,🔽concealment, proclamation, and so on.

original: gsang ba dang / bsgrags pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i don yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba dang / bsgrags pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i don yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, understanding this is the meaning of thorough understanding.

original: byams pa / de la yongs su shes pa ni de gnyis ka 'dzin par byed pa /
analyzed: byams pa / de la yongs su shes pa ni de gnyis ka 'dzin par byed pa /
translated: Maitreya, thorough understanding is that which holds both of those.

original: byang chub kyi @49b phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang yin pa dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi @49b phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gang yin pa dag ste /
translated: It is the dharmas that are in accord with awakening.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / de la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / de la sogs pa'o //
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, and so on.

original: byams pa / de la yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug 'dul ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la lus par spong ba dang / dge sbyong nyid kyi 'bras bu rnams dang / ngas nyan thos dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan 'jig rten pa dang /
analyzed: byams pa / de la yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa ni 'di lta ste / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug 'dul ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la lus par spong ba dang / dge sbyong nyid kyi 'bras bu rnams dang / ngas nyan thos dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan 'jig rten pa dang /
translated: Maitreya, the attainment of the fruit of thorough knowledge is as follows:🔽the taming of desire, anger, and ignorance, the abandonment of desire, anger, and ignorance, the fruits of asceticism, and the qualities of the śrāvakas and tathāgatas that I have taught, both mundane and supramundane, shared and unshared.

original: 'jig rten pa las 'das pa thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa gang dag bstan pa de dag mngon du bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa las 'das pa thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa gang dag bstan pa de dag mngon du bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of those.

original: byams pa / de la rab tu rig par byed pa ni mngon sum du byas pa'i chos de dag nyid las rnam par grol bar shes pa dang / gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher ston pa dang / yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa / de la rab tu rig par byed pa ni mngon sum du byas pa'i chos de dag nyid las rnam par grol bar shes pa dang / gzhan dag la'ang rgya cher ston pa dang / yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Maitreya, the one who is fully aware is the one who knows liberation from those very phenomena that have been actualized, who teaches them extensively to others, and who reveals them.

original: byams pa / don lnga po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa / don lnga po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that all topics are included in these five topics.

original: byams pa / yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bzhis don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa / yang byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bzhis don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: “Maitreya, there are four aspects of the bodhisattvas’ correct understanding of topics.

original: don rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: don rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four topics?

original: sems kyi len pa'i don dang / myong ba'i don dang / rnam par rig pa'i don dang; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i don gyis te /
analyzed: sems kyi len pa'i don dang / myong ba'i don dang / rnam par rig pa'i don dang; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i don gyis te /
translated: The topic of the mind’s appropriation, the topic of experience, the topic of cognition, and the topic of affliction and purification.

original: byams pa / don rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa / don rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that all topics are included in these four topics.

original: byams pa / @50a *//
analyzed: byams pa / @50a *//
translated: “Maitreya,

original: yang byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa gsum gyis don so so yang dag par rig pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva’s discernment of meaning is threefold.

original: don rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of meaning?

original: tshig 'bru'i don dang / don gyi don dang / khams kyi don gyis so //
analyzed: tshig 'bru'i don dang / don gyi don dang / khams kyi don gyis so //
translated: The meaning of the words, the meaning of the object, and the meaning of the elements.

original: byams pa / de la tshig 'bru'i don ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa / de la tshig 'bru'i don ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of the words should be regarded as the collection of names and so on.

original: byams pa / de la don gyi don ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste; de kho na'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spang ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon du bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: byams pa / de la don gyi don ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste; de kho na'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spang ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon du bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of the object should be understood as tenfold: the characteristic of reality, the characteristic of complete knowledge, the characteristic of abandonment, the characteristic of realization, the characteristic of cultivation,

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / gnas dang gnas par 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa de dag nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / gnas dang gnas par 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The characteristics of the aspects of reality, etc., are the characteristics of the differentiation of those very aspects, the characteristics of the connection between the basis and what is based on it, the characteristics of the phenomena that obstruct complete understanding, etc.,

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs dang / phan yon gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs dang / phan yon gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristics of the phenomena that are conducive to it, the disadvantages of not understanding, etc., and the benefits of complete understanding, etc.

original: byams pa / de la khams kyi don ni khams lnga ste /
analyzed: byams pa / de la khams kyi don ni khams lnga ste /
translated: Maitreya, the meaning of realm is the five realms:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dang / sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / 'dul ba'i khams dang / 'dul ba'i thabs kyi khams te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dang / sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / 'dul ba'i khams dang / 'dul ba'i thabs kyi khams te /
translated: the realm of the world, the realm of sentient beings, the realm of phenomena, the realm of those to be trained, and the realm of the methods of training.

original: byams pa / don rnam pa gsum po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa / don rnam pa gsum po de dag gis kyang don thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, one should know that all meanings are included in these three meanings.

original: bcom ldan @50b 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan @50b 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi sa don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa dang / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi sa don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa dang / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The perfect knowledge of the meaning that comes from the wisdom born of listening, the perfect knowledge of the meaning that comes from the wisdom born of reflection, and the perfect knowledge of the meaning that comes from the wisdom born of meditation.

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa de dag la tha dad du bgyi ba ci mchis lags /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis don so so yang dag par rig pa gang lags pa de dag la tha dad du bgyi ba ci mchis lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the difference between the thorough understanding of the meaning that comes from the wisdom that arises from listening, the thorough understanding of the meaning that comes from the wisdom that arises from reflection, and the thorough understanding of the meaning that comes from the wisdom that arises from meditation on śamatha and vipaśyanā?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: byams pa / byang chub sems dpas thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa /
analyzed: byams pa / byang chub sems dpas thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa /
translated: “Maitreya, through the wisdom that arises from listening, bodhisattvas thoroughly understand the meaning that is based on the words,

original: sgra ji bzhin pa /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa /
translated: that is literal,🔽that is not intended,

original: dgongs pa med pa; mngon du ma gyur pa /
analyzed: dgongs pa med pa; mngon du ma gyur pa /
translated: that is not manifest,

original: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su mthun pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su mthun pa /
translated: and that is conducive to liberation,

original: rnam par thar par byed pa ma yin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par thar par byed pa ma yin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed do //
translated: but not the meaning that brings about liberation.”

original: byams pa / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: byams pa / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa kho na yin la /
translated: Maitreya, through the wisdom that arises from reflection, one understands the meaning that is expressed in words,

original: sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin ma yin pa /
translated: that is not literal,

original: dgongs pa can /
analyzed: dgongs pa can /
translated: that is intentional,

original: mngon du gyur pa /
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa /
translated: that is manifest,

original: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su ches mthun pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su ches mthun pa /
translated: that is very much in accord with liberation,

original: rnam par thar par byed pa ma yin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig pa byed do //🔽byams pa / byang chub sems dpas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa dang / tshig 'bru la gnas pa ma yin pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa dang / dgongs pa can dang / shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan @51a *//
analyzed: rnam par thar par byed pa ma yin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig pa byed do // byams pa / byang chub sems dpas bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ni tshig 'bru la gnas pa dang / tshig 'bru la gnas pa ma yin pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa dang / dgongs pa can dang / shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan @51a *//
translated: and that is not the meaning that brings about liberation.🔽Maitreya, through the wisdom that arises from meditation, a bodhisattva understands the meaning that is expressed in words and that which is not expressed in words, that is literal and that which is not literal, that is intentional,

original: gyis mngon du gyur pa /
analyzed: gyis mngon du gyur pa /
translated: that is manifest through the images that are the domain of samādhi that are in accord with the things that are to be known,

original: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su chos shin tu mthun pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i rjes su chos shin tu mthun pa /
translated: that is very much in accord with liberation,

original: rnam par thar par byed pa'i don kyang so sor yang dag par rig par byed do /
analyzed: rnam par thar par byed pa'i don kyang so sor yang dag par rig par byed do /
translated: and that is the meaning that brings about liberation.

original: byams pa / de dag gi tha dad du bya ba ni de yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: byams pa / de dag gi tha dad du bya ba ni de yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom pa chos so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom pa chos so sor yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa ni gang lags /
translated: what is the knowledge of bodhisattvas who cultivate serenity and insight, the knowledge of the discernment of phenomena and the discernment of meaning?

original: mthong ba ni gang lags /
analyzed: mthong ba ni gang lags /
translated: What is seeing?

original: byams pa / nga ni shes pa dang / mthong ba rnam grangs du mas ston par byed mod kyi /
analyzed: byams pa / nga ni shes pa dang / mthong ba rnam grangs du mas ston par byed mod kyi /
translated: Maitreya, I teach knowledge and seeing in many ways.

original: 'on kyang mdor bsdus te bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mdor bsdus te bshad par bya'o //
translated: But I will explain them in brief.

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni shes pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge is the wisdom of serenity and insight that takes up mixed phenomena as its object.

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi shes rab gang yin pa de ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: The seeing is the wisdom of serenity and insight that takes up unmixed phenomena as its object.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom pas yid la bgyid pa gang gis mtshan ma gang ji ltar rnam par sel bar bgyid lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom pas yid la bgyid pa gang gis mtshan ma gang ji ltar rnam par sel bar bgyid lags /
translated: Bodhisattvas, by cultivating śamatha and vipaśyanā, what are the mental states by which they eliminate what signs?

original: byams pa / de bzhin nyid yid la byed pas chos kyi mtshan ma dang / don gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed la /
analyzed: byams pa / de bzhin nyid yid la byed pas chos kyi mtshan ma dang / don gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed la /
translated: Maitreya, by attending to suchness, they eliminate the sign of phenomena and the sign of meanings.

original: ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs shing de'i gnas mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel lo /
analyzed: ming la ming gi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs shing de'i gnas mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel lo /
translated: They eliminate by not observing the intrinsic reality of names and by not seeing the sign of their basis.

original: ming @51b la ji lta ba bzhin du tshig dang / yi ge dang / don thams cad la'ang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽byams pa / khams kyi bar la khams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: ming @51b la ji lta ba bzhin du tshig dang / yi ge dang / don thams cad la'ang de bzhin du rig par bya'o // byams pa / khams kyi bar la khams kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs shing /
translated: Just as with names, one should understand that it is the same for phrases, letters, and all meanings.

original: de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel lo //
analyzed: de'i gnas kyi mtshan ma'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas rnam par sel lo //
translated: Maitreya, they eliminate by not observing the intrinsic reality of the elements and by not seeing the sign of their basis.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ci lags / de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan ma gang lags pa de'ang rnam par sel bar bgyid lags sam /
analyzed: ci lags / de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan ma gang lags pa de'ang rnam par sel bar bgyid lags sam /
translated: “Is it also the case that the sign of the correct understanding of the meaning of suchness is eliminated?”

original: byams pa / de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa la ni mtshan ma med de mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byams pa / de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa la ni mtshan ma med de mi dmigs na /
translated: “Maitreya, the correct understanding of the meaning of suchness is signless and non-apprehensible.

original: de la ci zhig rnam par sel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ci zhig rnam par sel bar 'gyur te /
translated: So what is there to be eliminated?

original: byams pa / de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos dang don gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /
analyzed: byams pa / de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pas ni chos dang don gyi mtshan ma thams cad zil gyis gnon gyi /
translated: “Maitreya, the correct understanding of the meaning of suchness overwhelms all the signs of phenomena and their meanings.

original: de ni gang gis kyang zil gyis mnan par bya ba yin par nga mi smra'o //
analyzed: de ni gang gis kyang zil gyis mnan par bya ba yin par nga mi smra'o //
translated: But I do not say that it is overwhelmed by anything.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chab rnyog pa can mchis pa'i snod kyi dpe dang / me long yongs su ma dag pa'i dpe dang / mtshe'u 'khrugs pa'i dpes ji ltar rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma brtag par mi nus pa de las bzlog pa ni nus pa de bzhin du ma bsgoms pa'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chab rnyog pa can mchis pa'i snod kyi dpe dang / me long yongs su ma dag pa'i dpe dang / mtshe'u 'khrugs pa'i dpes ji ltar rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma brtag par mi nus pa de las bzlog pa ni nus pa de bzhin du ma bsgoms pa'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par mi nus kyi /
translated: The Blessed One has said that just as the natural signs cannot be discerned in a vessel of turbid water, in a mirror that is not completely clean, or in a disturbed pond, but can be discerned in their opposites, in the same way, the mind that is not cultivated cannot know reality as it is,🔽but the cultivated mind can.

original: bsgoms pas ni nus so zhes bka' stsal pa gang lags pa de la sems kyis so sor brtag pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: bsgoms pas ni nus so zhes bka' stsal pa gang lags pa de la sems kyis so sor brtag pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is the discernment of the mind?

original: de bzhin nyid ni gang las dgongs te bka' stsal pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gang las dgongs te bka' stsal pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is reality, and what is the intention behind the statement?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: byams pa / sems kyis so sor brtag pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir po @52a *//
analyzed: byams pa / sems kyis so sor brtag pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir po @52a *//
translated: Maitreya, it is because of three kinds of discernment of the mind.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i sems kyis so sor brtag pa'o //
translated: The investigation by the mind born of hearing, the investigation by the mind born of thinking, and the investigation by the mind born of meditation.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid las dgongs te yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid las dgongs te yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught with the intention of the suchness of cognition.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mtshan ma rnam par sel ba la zhugs pa'i mtshan ma du zhig ni rnam par bsal dka' ba dag lags la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar chos dang don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / mtshan ma rnam par sel ba la zhugs pa'i mtshan ma du zhig ni rnam par bsal dka' ba dag lags la /
translated: when bodhisattvas thus investigate the Dharma and its meaning, and engage in eliminating signs, how many signs are difficult to eliminate?

original: gang gis ni de dag rnam par sel lags /
analyzed: gang gis ni de dag rnam par sel lags /
translated: And by what means are they eliminated?

original: byams pa bcu ste /
analyzed: byams pa bcu ste /
translated: Maitreya, there are ten.

original: de dag ni stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
analyzed: de dag ni stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
translated: They are eliminated by emptiness.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: chos kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i tshig dang / yi ge'i mtshan ma sna tshogs gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
analyzed: chos kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i tshig dang / yi ge'i mtshan ma sna tshogs gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
translated: The various signs of words and letters that cause the understanding of the individual correct knowledge of the meaning of the Dharma are eliminated by the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang /🔽thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
analyzed: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
translated: The signs that follow the continuum of arising, destruction, abiding, and transformation that cause the understanding of the individual correct knowledge of the meaning of the suchness of abiding are eliminated by the emptiness of characteristics and the emptiness of no beginning and end.

original: 'dzin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan ma dang / nga'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni nang stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa @52b nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mtshan ma dang / nga'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni nang stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa @52b nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
translated: The signs of the view of the transitory collection and the signs of the thought “I am” that cause the understanding of the individual correct knowledge of the meaning of grasping are eliminated by the emptiness of the inner and the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: gzung ba'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i longs spyod la lta ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni phyi stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sal lo //
analyzed: gzung ba'i don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i longs spyod la lta ba'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni phyi stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sal lo //
translated: The sign of the enjoyment of the object of retention, which is the object of the analytical knowledges, is eliminated by the emptiness of the external.

original: yongs su longs spyod ba'i don du skyes pa dang / bud med kyi bsnyen bkur dang / yo byad dang ldan pa so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma dang / phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni phyi stong pa nyid dang /🔽rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod ba'i don du skyes pa dang / bud med kyi bsnyen bkur dang / yo byad dang ldan pa so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i nang gi bde ba'i mtshan ma dang / phyi rol gyi sdug pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni phyi stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
translated: The sign of internal pleasure, which is the enjoyment of the object of the analytical knowledges, endowed with the service of men and women and the requisites, and the sign of external beauty, is eliminated by the emptiness of the external and the emptiness of essential nature.

original: gnas kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i tshad med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //🔽gzugs med pa la brten te /
analyzed: gnas kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i tshad med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni chen po stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //🔽gzugs med pa la brten te /
translated: The sign of the object of the abode, which is the object of the analytical knowledges, is eliminated by the emptiness of the great.🔽The sign of the object of the formless, which is the object of the analytical knowledges, is eliminated by the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: nang gi zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
analyzed: nang gi zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //
translated: The signs of the internal, peaceful, and liberated reality are eliminated by the emptiness of conditioned phenomena.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / chos bdag med pa'i mtshan ma dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma dang / don dam pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The signs of the selflessness of persons, the signs of the selflessness of phenomena, the signs of mere representation, and the signs of the ultimate, which are the objects of correct knowledge that are the suchness of characteristics, are eliminated by the emptiness of the unlimited,🔽the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, and the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The signs of the unconditioned, which are the objects of correct knowledge that are the suchness of purification, are eliminated by the emptiness of nature,

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //🔽rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang / 'gyur @53a *//
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //🔽rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig par byed pa'i 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang / 'gyur @53a *//
translated: the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, and the emptiness of intrinsic nature of all phenomena.

original: ba med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med ba stong pa nyid kyis rnam pa sel lo //
analyzed: ba med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med ba stong pa nyid kyis rnam pa sel lo //
translated: The sign of the absence of that is eliminated by the emptiness of the uncompounded and the emptiness of nonrejection.

original: mtshan ma de'i gnyen po stong pa nyid de nyid yid la byed pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel lo //

translated: The sign of emptiness that is the attention to that very emptiness which is the antidote to that sign is eliminated by the emptiness of emptiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: mtshan ma rnam bcu rnam par sel bar bgyid na /

analyzed: mtshan ma gang rnam par sel bar bgyid cing 'ching ba'i mtshan ma gang las yongs su grol bar 'gyur lags /

translated: Maitreya, one eliminates the sign of the image that is the domain of meditative concentration and is liberated from the sign of the sign of the afflicted

analyzed: byams pa / stong pa nyid de dag ni dngos su na mtshan ma de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, you should know that these emptinesses are, in fact, the antidotes to those signs.
