original: de dag kun tu 'byung ba la sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jug go /
analyzed: de dag kun tu 'byung ba la sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jug go /
translated: He becomes indifferent to their arising.🔽In this way, he enters and dwells in this frequently, and from time to time he purifies his mind of obstacles, obscurations, and distractions.

original: de ltar zhugs shing de la mang du gnas pa dus dus su gegs dang / sgrib pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dag las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed pa de la nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la so sor rang rig pa de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun so sor rtogs pa'i shes pa rnam pa bdun skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs shing de la mang du gnas pa dus dus su gegs dang / sgrib pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dag las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed pa de la nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la so sor rang rig pa de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun so sor rtogs pa'i shes pa rnam pa bdun skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the seven kinds of knowledge that understand the seven aspects of reality arise in him, and he comes to understand the suchness that is to be realized by oneself.

original: de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: This is his path of seeing.

original: de thob phas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: de thob phas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pa yin /
translated: Having attained that, the bodhisattva enters into the faultless reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nrigs su skyes pa yin /🔽sa dang po thob @57a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nrigs su skyes pa yin / sa dang po thob @57a *//
translated: He is born into the family of the Tathagatas.

original: pa dang / sa de'i phan yon yang nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: pa dang / sa de'i phan yon yang nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: He has attained the first stage and also experiences the benefits of that stage.

original: des sngar zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong thob pas ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis thob pa yin no //
analyzed: des sngar zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong thob pas ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis thob pa yin no //
translated: Since he has previously attained serenity and insight, he has attained the two kinds of objects of meditation: with concepts, which is a reflected image, and without concepts, which is a reflected image.

original: de ltar na mthong ba'i lam thob pas dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na mthong ba'i lam thob pas dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin te /
translated: Thus, by attaining the path of seeing, he attains the object of meditation that is the limit of what can be known.

original: des gong ma gong ma rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs shing /
analyzed: des gong ma gong ma rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs shing /
translated: Engaged in the path of meditation on the higher stages,

original: dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed pa na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed pa na /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: when he brings to mind those very three kinds of objects of meditation,🔽he attains the three kinds of patient acceptance that constitute the highest point of the world.

original: dper na / la la zhig khye'u ches phra mos khye'u ches sbom po 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du de'ang khye'us khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du nang gi mtshan ma rnam par sel ba nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel🔽bar byed de /
analyzed: dper na / la la zhig khye'u ches phra mos khye'u ches sbom po 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du de'ang khye'us khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du nang gi mtshan ma rnam par sel ba nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed de /
translated: For example, just as a very small child can expel a very large child, so too, in the same way that a child expels a child, by the elimination of internal signs, it eliminates all signs that are consistent with the aspect of affliction.

original: mtshan ma rnams par sel ba na gnas ngan len rnams kyang rnam par sel bar byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams par sel ba na gnas ngan len rnams kyang rnam par sel bar byed do //
translated: When it eliminates signs, it also eliminates negative tendencies.

original: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad legs par bcom pas rim gyis sa gong ma gong ma rnams su gser lta bur sems rnam par spyod la /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad legs par bcom pas rim gyis sa gong ma gong ma rnams su gser lta bur sems rnam par spyod la /
translated: By thoroughly destroying all signs and negative tendencies, it gradually purifies the mind like gold on the higher and higher stages,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa'ang 'thob ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa'ang 'thob ste /
translated: and it attains the object of the accomplishment of its purpose, up to the complete realization of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: byams pa / byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la de ltar sgrub na bla na med @57b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byams pa / byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la de ltar sgrub na bla na med @57b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Maitreya, if bodhisattvas practice in this way, with regard to śamatha and vipaśyanā, they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sgrub par bgyid na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sgrub par bgyid na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas practice?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par sgrub pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par sgrub pa lags /
translated: How do they accomplish the great power of bodhisattvas?

original: byams pa / byang chub sems dpa' gnas drug la mkhas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa / byang chub sems dpa' gnas drug la mkhas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Maitreya, bodhisattvas who are skilled in six topics accomplish the great power of bodhisattvas.

original: sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / bslang ba la mkhas pa dang / 'phel ba la mkhas pa dang / 'grib pa la mkhas pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / bslang ba la mkhas pa dang / 'phel ba la mkhas pa dang / 'grib pa la mkhas pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: They are skill in the arising of mind, skill in abiding, skill in lifting up, skill in increase, skill in decrease, and skill in means.

original: ji ltar na sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they skilled in the arising of mind?

original: sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug shes na sems kyi skye ba la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas pa yin te /🔽de la sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug ni brtan pa dang snod rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug shes na sems kyi skye ba la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas pa yin te / de la sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug ni brtan pa dang snod rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: If one knows the sixteen aspects of the mind's generation, one is skilled in the mind's generation as it really is.🔽The sixteen aspects of the mind's generation are as follows:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa'i'o //
translated: The mind's generation that is the support and the container is the appropriating consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mind's generation that is the various aspects of the object is as follows:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa yul cig car 'dzin pa phyi rol dang / nang gi yul cig car 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa yul cig car 'dzin pa phyi rol dang / nang gi yul cig car 'dzin pa /
translated: The conceptual mental consciousness that simultaneously apprehends objects such as form and so on, that simultaneously apprehends external and internal objects,

original: skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam cig la cig car ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms par 'jug pa /
analyzed: skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam cig la cig car ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms par 'jug pa /
translated: that simultaneously enters many meditative absorptions in a single moment, a single instant, a single second,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po mthong ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po mthong ba /
translated: that sees many buddhafields,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mang po mthong ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mang po mthong ba /
translated: that sees many tathagatas,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na'i'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na'i'o //
translated: is only the conceptual mental consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chung @58a *//
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chung @58a *//
translated: The signs of the object are small.🔽

original: du rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: du rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cognition of a small objective mark is, for example,

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: that of those in the desire realm.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chen por gyur pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma chen por gyur pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cognition of a large objective mark is, for example,

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: that of those in the form realm.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma tshad med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma tshad med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cognition of an immeasurable objective mark is, for example,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: that of those in the sphere of infinite space and the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma phra mo rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma phra mo rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cognition of a subtle objective mark is, for example,

original: ci'ang med pa'i skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: ci'ang med pa'i skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: that of those in the sphere of nothingness.🔽The cognition of an ultimate objective mark is, for example,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma mthar thug pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste; 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma mthar thug pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste; 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: that of those in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: mtshan ma med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa rnam par rig pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cognition of the signless is, for example,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i'o //
translated: that of the supramundane and that which takes cessation as its object.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who possess suffering are, for example,

original: sems can dmyal ba'i 'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i 'o //
translated: hell beings.

original: tshor ba 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshor ba 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who possess mixed feelings are, for example,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'o //
translated: those in the desire realm.

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who possess joy are, for example,

original: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa ba'i 'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa ba'i 'o //
translated: those in the first and second absorptions.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who possess pleasure are, for example,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa pa'i'o //🔽sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa pa'i'o // sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: those in the third absorption.

original: bde ba'ang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who possess neither suffering nor pleasure are, for example,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i bar gyi'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i bar gyi'o //
translated: those in the fourth absorption up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa'i @58b ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa'i @58b ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who possess afflictions are, for example,

original: nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i 'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i 'o //
translated: those who possess afflictions and branch afflictions.

original: dge ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who possess virtue are, for example,

original: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'o //
translated: those who possess faith and so on.

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste; de gnyis ka'i dang mi ldan pa'i 'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i ni 'di lta ste; de gnyis ka'i dang mi ldan pa'i 'o //
translated: The one who is not endowed is the one who is not endowed with either.

original: ji ltar na gnas pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnas pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one skilled in abiding?

original: gal te rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: If one knows the suchness of cognition just as it is.

original: ji ltar na bslang ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bslang ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one skilled in rising?

original: gal te 'ching ba rnams pa gnyis po mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gal te 'ching ba rnams pa gnyis po mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
translated: If one knows just as it is the two kinds of bondage: the bondage of signs and the bondage of negative tendencies.

original: de rab tu shes nas de las sems 'di bslang par bya'o zhes bya ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de rab tu shes nas de las sems 'di bslang par bya'o zhes bya ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Having known that, one is skilled in the thought that “this mind should be raised from that.”

original: ji ltar na 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one skilled in increase?

original: gal te mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po'i sems gang yin pa de skye ba dang / 'phel ba'i tshe skye ba dang / 'phel lo zhes 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po'i sems gang yin pa de skye ba dang / 'phel ba'i tshe skye ba dang / 'phel lo zhes 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: If one knows that the mind which is the antidote to signs and negative tendencies increases and grows when it arises and grows, one is skilled in increase.

original: ji ltar na 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they skilled in decrease?

original: gal te de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa mtshan ma gnas ngan len gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems de 'grib cing 'bri bar gyur pa na 'grib cing 'bri'o zhes 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa mtshan ma gnas ngan len gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems de 'grib cing 'bri bar gyur pa na 'grib cing 'bri'o zhes 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: If the afflicted mind that is the basis for the signs of negative reflex actions decreases and diminishes, they are skilled in decrease.

original: ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they skilled in means?

original: gal te rnam par thar pa dang zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dag dang / zad par gyi skye mched dag sgom par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam par thar pa dang zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dag dang / zad par gyi skye mched dag sgom par byed pa ste /
translated: If they cultivate the liberations, the spheres of mastery, and the spheres of totality.🔽Maitreya,

original: byams pa / de ltar na @59a *//
analyzed: byams pa / de ltar na @59a *//
translated: in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / mngon par sgrub par 'gyur pa dang / mngon par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / mngon par sgrub par 'gyur pa dang / mngon par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: the bodhisattvas accomplish, will accomplish, and do accomplish the great power of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad ma lus par 'gag go zhes gang gsungs pa la; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad ma lus par 'gag go zhes gang gsungs pa la; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Blessed One has said, “In the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates, all feelings without exception cease.”

original: yang dag pa'i tshor ba de dag gang lags /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshor ba de dag gang lags /
translated: Blessed One, what are those true feelings?

original: byams pa / mdor bsdus na tshor ba rnam pa gnyis 'gag ste /
analyzed: byams pa / mdor bsdus na tshor ba rnam pa gnyis 'gag ste /
translated: Maitreya, in brief, two kinds of feelings cease:

original: gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa'o //
translated: the awareness of the negative tendencies that are the bases, and the awareness of the objects that are their results.

original: de la gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig ste /
analyzed: de la gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig ste /
translated: “The awareness of the negative tendencies that are the bases” should be understood as fourfold:

original: gzugs kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang / gzugs med pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa dang; 'bras bu grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa dang / 'bras bu ma grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi gnas ngan len rig pa dang / gzugs med pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa dang; 'bras bu grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa dang / 'bras bu ma grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa'o //
translated: the awareness of the negative tendencies related to the form realm, the awareness of the negative tendencies related to the formless realm, the awareness of the negative tendencies related to the established result, and the awareness of the negative tendencies related to the nonestablished result.

original: de la 'bras bu grub pa ni da ltar gyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu grub pa ni da ltar gyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: “The established result” is what is present in the present.

original: 'bras bu ma grub pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma grub pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “The nonestablished result” is what is the cause of the future.

original: yul rig pa'ang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yul rig pa'ang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The object of awareness should also be understood in four ways:

original: gnas rig pa dang / yo byad rig pa dang / longs spyod rig pa dang / ltos pa rig pa'o; ;de'ang phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na'o //
analyzed: gnas rig pa dang / yo byad rig pa dang / longs spyod rig pa dang / ltos pa rig pa'o; ;de'ang phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na'o //
translated: awareness of the abode, awareness of the requisites, awareness of enjoyment, and awareness of dependence.

original: 'bras bu ma grub par rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba myong ba de'i mi mthun pa'i @59b phyags thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma grub par rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba myong ba de'i mi mthun pa'i @59b phyags thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gag pa ma yin te /
translated: The feeling that arises from contact associated with awareness is not completely blocked in the realm of nirvana with residual aggregates.

original: 'dren mar myong ngo //
analyzed: 'dren mar myong ngo //
translated: It is experienced in a mixed way.

original: 'bras bu grub pa myong ba'i ni tshor ba rnam pa de gnyis ka thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags te /
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pa myong ba'i ni tshor ba rnam pa de gnyis ka thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gags te /
translated: The feeling that arises from contact associated with awareness is completely blocked in the realm of nirvana without residual aggregates.

original: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig myong ngo //
analyzed: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig myong ngo //
translated: Only the feeling that arises from contact associated with awareness remains.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na de'ang 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na de'ang 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: When one passes into complete nirvana in the realm of nirvana without residual aggregates, that feeling also ceases.

original: de'i phyir phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad 'gag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad 'gag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that all feelings cease in the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: Having said this,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: byams pa khyod kyis rnal 'byor gyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: byams pa khyod kyis rnal 'byor gyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu yongs su dag pa las brtsams nas /
translated: “Maitreya, you have asked the Tathāgata about the path of yoga, beginning with its completion and its purification.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rnal 'byor la shin tu rnam par nges shing mkhas pas de bzhin gshegs pa la dri ba dris pa legs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor la shin tu rnam par nges shing mkhas pas de bzhin gshegs pa la dri ba dris pa legs so //
translated: By being very certain and skilled in yoga, you have asked the Tathāgata a question.

original: legs so // ngas kyang rnal 'byor gyi lam de yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su dag par bstan te; 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang de ltar bstan cing ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: legs so // ngas kyang rnal 'byor gyi lam de yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su dag par bstan te; 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang de ltar bstan cing ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: I have also taught the path of yoga, which is complete and pure, and all the perfect buddhas of the past and the future have also taught it and will teach it.

original: rigs kyi bu rnams dang / rigs kyi bu mo dag gis 'di lta shin tu brtson par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rnams dang / rigs kyi bu mo dag gis 'di lta shin tu brtson par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Noble sons and daughters should be very diligent in this.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //🔽chos rnams gdags pa @60a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to // chos rnams gdags pa @60a *//
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses:

original: rnam gzhag gang yin pa //
analyzed: rnam gzhag gang yin pa //
translated: The presentation of the designations of phenomena

original: de ni rnal 'byor bag yod don chen yin //
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor bag yod don chen yin //
translated: Is the great purpose for the careful yogi.

original: gang dag chos der brten nas rnal 'byor 'dir //
analyzed: gang dag chos der brten nas rnal 'byor 'dir //
translated: Those who, based on that Dharma,

original: yang dag brtson pa de dag byang chub 'thob //
analyzed: yang dag brtson pa de dag byang chub 'thob //
translated: are diligent in this yoga will attain awakening.

original: gang dag glags lta de skad rgol ba las //
analyzed: gang dag glags lta de skad rgol ba las //
translated: Those who, seeking an opportunity, argue thus,

original: thar par lta ba chos kun chub byed pa //
analyzed: thar par lta ba chos kun chub byed pa //
translated: thinking liberation comes from grasping all phenomena,

original: byams pa de dag rnal 'byor 'di las ni //
analyzed: byams pa de dag rnal 'byor 'di las ni //
translated: are far from liberation in this yoga,

original: thar ring gnam sa ring ba ji bzhin no //🔽blo ldan sems can don zhes de dag las //
analyzed: thar ring gnam sa ring ba ji bzhin no // blo ldan sems can don zhes de dag las //
translated: as far apart as heaven and earth.🔽The wise do not strive for the benefit of beings

original: lan byed rig nas sems can don brtson min //
analyzed: lan byed rig nas sems can don brtson min //
translated: in order to receive something in return.🔽If they thought of a return, they would not be the best of all,

original: lan de rtog na kun gyi dam pa dang // zang zing med pa'i dga' ba 'thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: lan de rtog na kun gyi dam pa dang // zang zing med pa'i dga' ba 'thob mi 'gyur //
translated: and would not attain the joy of the unconditioned.

original: gang dag 'dod phyir chos kyi lung 'bog pa //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod phyir chos kyi lung 'bog pa //
translated: Those who give the Dharma for the sake of desire

original: de dag 'dod pa spangs pa phyir len te //🔽rmongs pa de dag chos kyi rin po che //
analyzed: de dag 'dod pa spangs pa phyir len te // rmongs pa de dag chos kyi rin po che //
translated: Take up desire again after they have given it up.🔽Those fools, having found the priceless jewel of the Dharma,

original: rin thang med pa rnyed kyang spong zhing rgyu //
analyzed: rin thang med pa rnyed kyang spong zhing rgyu //
translated: Abandon it and wander off.

original: de phyir rtsod dang 'du 'dzi spros ldan pa //
analyzed: de phyir rtsod dang 'du 'dzi spros ldan pa //
translated: Therefore, abandon disputes, distractions, and elaborations,

original: rnam par spongs te brtson 'grus mchog byos te //
analyzed: rnam par spongs te brtson 'grus mchog byos te //
translated: And apply yourselves with the highest diligence.

original: lhar bcas 'jig rten bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lhar bcas 'jig rten bsgral bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to liberate the world with its gods,

original: rnal 'byor 'di la rab tu brtson par gyis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'di la rab tu brtson par gyis //
translated: Strive in this yoga.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Maitreya said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'dir bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: what is the name of this Dharma discourse that teaches the definitive meaning?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
translated: How should I remember it?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: byams pa / 'di ni rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: byams pa / 'di ni rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa yin te /
translated: “Maitreya, this is the teaching on the definitive meaning of yoga.

original: rnal 'byor nges pa'i don @60b bstan pa zhes bya bar gzung zhig /
analyzed: rnal 'byor nges pa'i don @60b bstan pa zhes bya bar gzung zhig /
translated: You should hold it as the teaching on the definitive meaning for yogins.🔽When this teaching on the definitive meaning for yogins was explained, the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening arose in 600,000 living beings.

original: rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so; ;nyan thos sum 'bum ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam🔽par dag go /
analyzed: rnal 'byor nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na srog chags drug 'bum ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so; ;nyan thos sum 'bum ni chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: 300,000 śrāvakas became free of dust and uncontaminated with regard to phenomena,

original: nyan thos 'bum lnga khri ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: nyan thos 'bum lnga khri ni len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: and 150,000 śrāvakas’ minds were liberated from contaminants without further appropriation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni rnal 'byor chen po'i yid la byed pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni rnal 'byor chen po'i yid la byed pa thob par gyur to //
translated: 75,000 bodhisattvas attained the mental activity of great yoga.🔽This was the eighth chapter, on Maitreya, of this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.

original: byams pa'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o;; ;;de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug gis zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: byams pa'i le'u ste brgyad pa'o;; ;;de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug gis zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara asked the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One!

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bcu gang lags pa de dag ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bcu gang lags pa de dag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the ten?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba zhes bgyi ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang; 'od 'phro ba can dang / shin tu spyang dka' dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba zhes bgyi ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang; 'od 'phro ba can dang / shin tu spyang dka' dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang /
translated: They are the bodhisattva stages called Perfect Joy, Stainless, Shining, Brilliance, Hard to Conquer, Realized, Far Reaching, Unshakable,

original: legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin lags /
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin lags /
translated: Excellent Intelligence, and Cloud of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni bcu gcig pa lags na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni bcu gcig pa lags na /
translated: The Buddha stage is the eleventh.

original: sa de dag rnam par dag pa du dag dang / yan lag du dag gis bsdus lags /
analyzed: sa de dag rnam par dag pa du dag dang / yan lag du dag gis bsdus lags /
translated: How many purities and how many aspects are included in those stages?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: spyan @61a *// ras gzigs dbang phyug /
analyzed: spyan @61a *// ras gzigs dbang phyug /
translated: Avalokiteśvara,

original: de dag ni rnam par dag pa bzhi dang / yan lag bcu gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par dag pa bzhi dang / yan lag bcu gcig gis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: know that they are included in four purities and eleven aspects.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
translated: Avalokiteśvara,

original: de la sa dang po ni bsam pa rnam par dag pas bsdus so //
analyzed: de la sa dang po ni bsam pa rnam par dag pas bsdus so //
translated: on the first stage, the bodhisattvas’ intention is pure.

original: sa gnyis pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The second level is that of The Stainless One, because it is the level of the purity of superior discipline.

original: sa gsum pa ni lhag pa'i sems rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: sa gsum pa ni lhag pa'i sems rnam par dag pas so //
translated: The third level is that of The Luminous One, because it is the level of the purity of superior mind training.

original: sa bzhi pa nas bzung ste sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar ni lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pa gong nas gong du gya nom pa bas kyang ches gya nom pas bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa nas bzung ste sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar ni lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pa gong nas gong du gya nom pa bas kyang ches gya nom pas bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: The fourth level and the rest, up to and including the level of buddha, are to be understood as being subsumed by the purity of superior wisdom, which is more sublime than sublime.

original: sa de dag ni rnam par dag  bzhi po dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sa de dag ni rnam par dag  bzhi po dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: These ten spiritual levels are subsumed by the four purities.

original: yan lag bcu gcig gang zhe na /🔽spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug; mos pas spyod pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' chos spyad pa rnam pa bcu po dag la mos pa shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir bzod pas sa de las yang dag par 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med
analyzed: yan lag bcu gcig gang zhe na / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug; mos pas spyod pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' chos spyad pa rnam pa bcu po dag la mos pa shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir bzod pas sa de las yang dag par 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med
translated: What are the eleven elements?🔽Avalokiteśvara, on the level of earnest aspiration, the bodhisattva cultivates the ten aspects of Dharma practice and, on the basis of that cultivation, attains the acceptance that objects are not produced.

original: pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: pa la 'jug go /
translated: Having transcended that level by means of that acceptance, he enters into the bodhisattva’s state of utmost clarity and purity.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun tu 'byung ba dag la shes bzhin du spyod par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun tu 'byung ba dag la shes bzhin du spyod par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Although he is complete in that branch, he is not complete in that branch since he is unable to practice with vigilance the avoidance of the occurrence of subtle infractions.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang @61b 'thob bo //
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang @61b 'thob bo //
translated: He strives to complete that branch and he obtains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa thob par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa thob par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Although he is complete in that branch, he is not complete in that branch since he is unable to enter the perfect mundane meditative stabilization and to obtain the perfect retention of what is heard.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas /
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas /
translated: He strives to complete that branch and he obtains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ji ltar thob pa dag gis de la mang du gnas par bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa las sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jug mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos ji ltar thob pa dag gis de la mang du gnas par bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa las sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jug mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Although he is complete in that member, he is not yet able to remain in the many ways that he has attained the factors of enlightenment, and he is not yet able to remain in equanimity with respect to his craving for meditative absorption and craving for phenomena.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob bo //
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, he strives to complete that member and he attains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang bden pa rnams rnam par dpyad pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa'i yid la byed pa lhag par btang snyoms su bzhag ste /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang bden pa rnams rnam par dpyad pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid dang / mngon du phyogs pa'i yid la byed pa lhag par btang snyoms su bzhag ste /
translated: Although he is complete in that member, he is not yet able to remain in equanimity with respect to his analysis of the four noble truths and his mental attention that is either directed to samsara or directed to nirvana.

original: thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams bsgom par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Since he is not able to cultivate the factors of enlightenment that are embraced by means, that factor is incomplete for him.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob @62a *//
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob @62a *//
translated: Since he strives to complete that factor, he attains it.

original: bo; ;de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang 'du byed kyi 'jug pa ji lta ba bzhin mngon sum du byas nas de la skyo ba mang ba dang; mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pas de yongs su ma🔽rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bo; ;de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang 'du byed kyi 'jug pa ji lta ba bzhin mngon sum du byas nas de la skyo ba mang ba dang; mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pas de yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Even though that factor is complete for him, he is not able to manifest the engagement of the formative forces as it is and to abide with a great deal of disenchantment with them and with a great deal of attention to the signless.🔽Since that factor is incomplete for him,

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob bo //
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob bo //
translated: since he strives to complete that factor, he attains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang bar chad med pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pas /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang bar chad med pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pas mang du gnas par mi nus pas /
translated: Even though that factor is complete for him, he is not able to abide with a great deal of attention to the signless in a manner that is uninterrupted and free from obstacles.

original: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: He is not complete in that member.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob bo //
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob bo //
translated: He strives to complete that member and he obtains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang mtshan ma med par gnas pa de la rtsol ba lhag par btang snyoms su bzhag pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang thob par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang mtshan ma med par gnas pa de la rtsol ba lhag par btang snyoms su bzhag pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang thob par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: He is complete in that member, but he is not able to attain equanimity in the exertion of remaining in the signless, and he is not able to attain mastery in the sign. He is not complete in that member.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad bas de'ang 'thob bo; ;de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu dbye bas rnam pa thams cad du chos @62b ston pa la'ang dbang thob par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad bas de'ang 'thob bo; ;de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / rab tu dbye bas rnam pa thams cad du chos @62b ston pa la'ang dbang thob par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: He strives to complete that member and he obtains it. He is complete in that member, but he is not able to attain mastery in teaching the Dharma in all its modes through enumeration, characteristic, explanation, and division. He is not complete in that member.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob bo //
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob bo //
translated: He strives to complete that branch and attains it.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa 'thob par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa 'thob par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Although he has completed that branch, he is unable to attain the complete Dharma body and the analytical knowledges.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob bo //
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pas de'ang 'thob bo //
translated: He strives to complete that branch and attains it.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba thob par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin yang shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba thob par mi nus pas de yan lag des yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Although he has completed that branch, he is unable to attain the unobstructed knowledge and vision of all that is to be known.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad bas de'ang 'thob ste /
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'bad bas de'ang 'thob ste /
translated: He strives to complete that branch and attains it.

original: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yan lag de yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: He has completed that branch.

original: de yan lag des yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /

original: sa bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa'i shing bsreg pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sgom pa de ye shes kyi me'i 'od 'phro bar gyur pa'i phyir 'od 'phro can zhes bya'o //

translated: The fourth stage is called the Brilliant because that cultivation of the factors of enlightenment burns the wood of the afflictions, and the light of the fire of knowledge spreads.

original: sa lnga pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos de dag nyid thabs kyis sgom pa de la dbang bya bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir shin tu sbyang dka' zhes bya'o //

original: sa drug pa ni 'du byed kyi 'jug pa mngon sum du gyur pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa mang du yid la byed pa mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir mngon du gyur ces bya'o //

translated: The sixth stage is called the Facing because it is the direct realization of the engagement of the formative forces and the direct realization of the frequent attention to the signless.

original: sa bdun pa ni mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa bar chad med cing rgyun mi 'chad par ring du rjes su zhugs pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i sa dang rjes su 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir ring du song ba @63b zhes bya'o //

translated: The seventh stage is called Far-reaching because it is the stage of the long-practiced, uninterrupted, and continuous performance of the attention to the signless, and because it is the stage that is connected with the pure stage.

original: sa brgyad pa ni mtshan ma med pa la lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / mtshan ma'i nyon mongs pa kun tu byung bas mi bskyod pa nyid kyi phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //

translated: The eighth stage is called Immovable because it is the stage of the spontaneous performance of the signless, and because it is unshaken by the arising of the passions of signs.

original: sa dgu ba ni rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang la kha na mtho ba med pa'i blo gros shin tu yangs pa thob pa nyid kyi phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //

translated: The ninth stage is called Good Intelligence because it is the stage of the attainment of the vast and irreproachable intelligence that is the mastery of teaching the Dharma in all its aspects.

original: sa bcu pa ni gnas ngan len gyi lus nam mkha' lta bu la chos kyi tshogs sprin chen lta bus khyab cing khebs pa'i phyir chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //

original: sa bcu gcig pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo spangs pas chags pa med cing thogs pa med par shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya'o //

translated: The eleventh stage is called Buddha because, by eliminating the extremely subtle afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience, one is completely enlightened with respect to all aspects of knowledge without attachment or obstruction.

original: bcom ldan 'das /

translated: Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams smon lam rgya chen pos mchi ba dang / smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs can lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams smon lam rgya chen pos mchi ba dang / smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs can lags /
translated: Why do bodhisattvas go by means of vast aspirations, have excellent aspirations, and have the power of aspiration?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, it is for four reasons:

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i @66a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i @66a *//
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas are skilled in abiding in the bliss of nirvāṇa,

original: bde ba la gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / de myur du 'thob par nus pa dang / myur du thob pa de dang bde bar gnas pa de'ang spangs te /
analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / de myur du 'thob par nus pa dang / myur du thob pa de dang bde bar gnas pa de'ang spangs te /
translated: are able to attain it quickly, and having abandoned that quick attainment and that blissful abiding,

original: sems can gyi don rgyu ba med pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi don rgyu ba med pa /
translated: they mentally aspire to the occurrence of the benefit of sentient beings,

original: dgos pa med pa /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa /
translated: which is purposeless,

original: sdug bsngal mang po sna tshogs yun ring po 'byung ba la yid kyis smon par byed pas te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po sna tshogs yun ring po 'byung ba la yid kyis smon par byed pas te /
translated: and which is the occurrence of many kinds of suffering for a long time.

original: de'i phyir smon lam rgya chen pos 'gro ba dang / smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs can rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir smon lam rgya chen pos 'gro ba dang / smon lam gya nom pa dang ldan pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs can rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to go by means of vast aspirations, have excellent aspirations, and have the power of aspiration.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi du mchis lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi du mchis lags /
translated: How many bases of training are there for bodhisattvas?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug drug ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug drug ste /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, there are six:

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab bo //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab bo //
translated: generosity, morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gzhi drug po de dag las du ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa lags /
analyzed: gzhi drug po de dag las du ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa lags /
translated: among these six bases, how many are the training in the higher morality?

original: du ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa lags /
analyzed: du ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa lags /
translated: How many are the training in the higher mind?

original: du ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa lags /
analyzed: du ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa lags /
translated: How many are the training in the higher wisdom?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang po gsum ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang po gsum ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, you should know that the first three are the training in the higher morality.

original: bsam gtan ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: Concentration is the training in the higher mind.

original: shes rab ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yin no //
translated: Wisdom is the training in the higher wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus ni kun tu 'gro ba yin par nga smra'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni kun tu 'gro ba yin par nga smra'o //
translated: I say that perseverance is universal.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag las du @66b ni bsod nams kyi tshogs lags /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag las du @66b ni bsod nams kyi tshogs lags /
translated: From among these six bases of training, how many are the accumulation of merit?

original: du ni ye shes kyi tshogs lags /
analyzed: du ni ye shes kyi tshogs lags /
translated: How many are the accumulation of wisdom?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: Avalokiteśvara, the training in superior morality is the accumulation of merit.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: The training in superior wisdom is the accumulation of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan ni kun tu 'gro ba yin par nga smra'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan ni kun tu 'gro ba yin par nga smra'o //
translated: I say that effort and concentration are universal.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la byang chub sems dpas ji ltar bslab par bgyi lags /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi drug po de dag la byang chub sems dpas ji ltar bslab par bgyi lags /
translated: how should bodhisattvas train in these six bases of training?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa lngas te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa lngas te /
translated: Avalokiteśvara, in five ways:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos bstan pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos bstan pa /
translated: the teaching of the holy Dharma endowed with the perfections,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la thog ma kho nar shin tu mos pa dang / de'i 'og tu chos spyad pa bcu po dag gis thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab bsgrub pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la thog ma kho nar shin tu mos pa dang / de'i 'og tu chos spyad pa bcu po dag gis thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab bsgrub pa dang / byang chub kyi sems rjes su bsrung ba dang /
translated: Then, by means of the ten Dharma practices, he should accomplish the wisdom that comes from listening, reflection, and meditation, and he should protect the spirit of enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas bslab par bya'o //
translated: He should rely on a spiritual teacher and apply himself uninterruptedly to the side of virtue.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du bslab pa'i gzhi de dag grangs drug tu gdags par rig par bgyi lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du bslab pa'i gzhi de dag grangs drug tu gdags par rig par bgyi lags /
translated: why should these bases of training be known as being comprised of six groups?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: Avalokitesvara, it is for two reasons:

original: sems can la phan gdags pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can la phan gdags pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they benefit sentient beings and because they are antidotes to the afflictions.

original: de la gsum ni sems can la phan na gdags pa yin la /🔽gsum ni nyon mongs @67a *//
analyzed: de la gsum ni sems can la phan na gdags pa yin la / gsum ni nyon mongs @67a *//
translated: Among them, three benefit sentient beings,

original: pa'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pa'i gnyen po yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: and three should be known as antidotes to the afflictions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pas ni sems can rnams la yo byad nye bar bsgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pas ni sems can rnams la yo byad nye bar bsgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: The bodhisattva benefits sentient beings by means of generosity, by providing them with material necessities.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang / rnam par mtho 'tsham pa nye bar mi sgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang / rnam par mtho 'tsham pa nye bar mi sgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas phan 'dogs so //
translated: By means of morality, he benefits them by not harming them, by not oppressing them.

original: bzod pas ni phongs pa dang gnod pa dang rnam par mtho 'tsham pa la ci mi snyam pas phan 'dogs te /
analyzed: bzod pas ni phongs pa dang gnod pa dang rnam par mtho 'tsham pa la ci mi snyam pas phan 'dogs te /
translated: By means of patience, he benefits them by not retaliating when they harm him, by not taking offense.

original: de gsum gyis ni sems can la phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: de gsum gyis ni sems can la phan 'dogs so //
translated: By means of these three, he benefits sentient beings.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par bcil ba dang / nyon mongs pa yang dag par bcom pa'i dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par bcil ba dang / nyon mongs pa yang dag par bcom pa'i dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: By means of effort, he applies himself to the virtuous side in order to eliminate the afflictions and to destroy the afflictions.

original: de ni nyon mongs pas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba las bskyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba las bskyod par mi nus so //
translated: He cannot be moved from applying himself to the virtuous side by the afflictions.

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par gnon to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par gnon to //
translated: By means of the meditative absorptions, he suppresses the afflictions.

original: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms par byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms par byed de /
translated: Wisdom is the one that completely destroys the latent tendencies.

original: de gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: These three are the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag grangs bzhir gdags par rig par bgyi lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag grangs bzhir gdags par rig par bgyi lags /
translated: why should the other perfections be known as the four enumerations?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
translated: Avalokiteśvara,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid kyi grogs su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid kyi grogs su gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is because they are the very companions of those six perfections.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyis sems can rnams la phan btags nas byang chub @67b sems dpas bsdu ba'i dngos pos zin pa'i thabs la mkhas pas dge ba la 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyis sems can rnams la phan btags nas byang chub @67b sems dpas bsdu ba'i dngos pos zin pa'i thabs la mkhas pas dge ba la 'jog par byed de /
translated: There, after bodhisattvas have benefited sentient beings with three perfections, they establish them in virtue with the means of skill in means that is included in the means of gathering.

original: de'i phyir ngas thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsum po dag gi grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngas thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsum po dag gi grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
translated: Therefore, I have taught that the perfection of skill in means is the companion of those three.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
translated: Avalokiteśvara,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa mang bas rtag tu sgom mi nus pa dang / khams dang mos pa dma' ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung bas sems nang du 'jog mi nus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa'i dmigs pa la bsam gtan yongs su ma bsgoms pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par sgrub mi nus pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa mang bas rtag tu sgom mi nus pa dang / khams dang mos pa dma' ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung bas sems nang du 'jog mi nus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa'i dmigs pa la bsam gtan yongs su ma bsgoms pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par sgrub mi nus pa yin na /
translated: and is unable to accomplish supramundane wisdom because of not having fully cultivated concentration on the objects of meditation of listening to the bodhisattva canon,🔽then, having taken up even a small accumulation of merit, he should mentally aspire to have few afflictions in the future.

original: de bsod nams kyi tshogs chung ngu'ang yang dag par blangs te gnas shing phyi ma la nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid du yid kyis smon par byed pa de ni de'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: de bsod nams kyi tshogs chung ngu'ang yang dag par blangs te gnas shing phyi ma la nyon mongs pa chung ba nyid du yid kyis smon par byed pa de ni de'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: That is his perfection of aspiration.

original: des nyon mongs pa chung ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom nus par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa chung ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom nus par 'gyur bas /
translated: Because of that, he will have few afflictions and be able to apply diligence.

original: de'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //🔽des skyes bu dam pa yang dag par bsten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la brten nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa thob cing lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung ba nyid rnam par @68a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no // des skyes bu dam pa yang dag par bsten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la brten nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa thob cing lhag pa'i bsam pa stobs chung ba nyid rnam par @68a *//
translated: Therefore, the perfection of vows is the support of the perfection of effort.

original: bzlog nas khams gya nom pa las bsam pa'i stobs thob par 'gyur ba de ni de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: bzlog nas khams gya nom pa las bsam pa'i stobs thob par 'gyur ba de ni de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: Having relied on the perfect service of holy beings and the listening to the holy Dharma, he obtains the proper mental attention and, having turned away from the weakness of the aspiration, obtains the strength of the aspiration from the excellent element. That is his perfection of strength.

original: des sems nang du 'jog nus pas /
analyzed: des sems nang du 'jog nus pas /
translated: Because he is able to settle the mind inwardly,

original: de'i phyir stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: therefore, the perfection of strength is the support of the perfection of meditation.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa'i dmigs pa yongs su bsgoms pa la bsam gtan byed de /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa'i dmigs pa yongs su bsgoms pa la bsam gtan byed de /
translated: There, the bodhisattva practices meditation on the object of meditation that consists of listening to the canon of the bodhisattva.

original: de ni de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: That is his perfection of wisdom.

original: des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par sgrub nus par 'gyur bas de'i phyir ngas ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par sgrub nus par 'gyur bas de'i phyir ngas ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grogs su gyur pa yin par yongs su bstan to //
translated: Because it is able to accomplish supramundane wisdom, therefore I have taught that the perfection of direct intuition is the companion of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gi go rim de ltar bstan par rig par bgyi lags /
analyzed: ci'i slad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag gi go rim de ltar bstan par rig par bgyi lags /
translated: why should the sequence of these six perfections be known?

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug /
translated: Avalokitesvara,

original: de dag gong nas gong du 'grub pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gong nas gong du 'grub pa'i rten nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they are the very basis for the accomplishment of the higher and higher.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lus dang longs spyod la mi lta na tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus dang longs spyod la mi lta na tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: When the bodhisattva is not concerned with body and possessions, he undertakes morality.

original: tshul khrims rjes su srung na bzod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su srung na bzod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he guards morality, he becomes endowed with patience.

original: bzod pa dang ldan na brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan na brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he is endowed with patience, he undertakes vigor.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams na bsam gtan sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams na bsam gtan sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he undertakes vigor, he accomplishes meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan @68b grub na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab 'thob bo //
analyzed: bsam gtan @68b grub na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab 'thob bo //
translated: If one accomplishes meditation, one obtains supramundane wisdom.
